A week and a day after I drunkenly misplaced my prized possession, they were able to immediately produce my jacket when queried. I thought it was gone forever. HONESTY, what a refreshing quality for a quirky dive bar. Thanks guys! Thank you Tom!
author: Erica K.

description:
What can be said that has not been said before....hmm. Lemme see. 

Decent pours on hard alcohol. Watching a drunk girl dance the pole is exponentially more entertaining than the spliced porn turrettes that happens on the screens. 

A lot of space for a small bar...lots of seating and the people were friendly. This area of Polk is pretty erratic and diverse when searching for libations to consume so, for those faint of heart, if this place is too jarring you can walk a few yards and go elsewhere, but give it a chance!

First time ever going was just this past weekend for a friend's birthday. It was fun...once I put the porn in the back of my mind I could talk to people without making weird "wtf faces" from the shocking scene changes playing out in the corner of my eye.
author: Jay H.

description:
Its different! Enjoyed the rustic theme -car seats, water bed, jacuzzi, and ;) 
bar was very lively even on a tuesday evening. Cosmopolitan I ordered was good. Service was quick.
And yes they play 3 second porn clip in between!!!
author: Astha S.

description:
Kozy Kar has become one of my go to bars in the city. The atmosphere and the music are fun. The porn on the walls (and the flashes of porn on the t.v.'s) keeps the place interesting. The drinks are inexpensive and stiff and the crowd is upbeat and interesting, in a good way.

The only downside is that it is difficult to get a seat and their seats are awesome! They are made out of old car seats and hot tubs!  I definitely recommend getting hear early to claim your seating corner.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Yeah it's not clean so I wouldn't come to this bar on a full bladder. Come here to weird out your friends about the porn that randomly pops up on the TV sets and $5 drinks! Unfortunately there are only about 4 tables so it's pretty hard to snag a seat.
author: Aradhana V.

description:
On our first date, my now boyfriend picked me up in a van. Not just your average conversion van, but a 12-passenger van. With windows ('cause otherwise that would make it a terrorist van). It was so big that you literally have to step up to get in the passenger seat. 

Although my boyfriend has since traded in the giant van for a hybrid, we still joke about that night. Kozy Kar brought back memories of that first date. It's so fun and unexpected, just like that first night together.
author: Abby S.

description:
The first time I walked in here I was in disbelief. 

I ordered a drink and scanned the bar as my drunken mind struggled to process what I was seeing. Is that ... is that a water bed with a retro shaggy bedspread??? Wait ... was that 5 seconds of 80's porn on the TV?? Is the floor of the bathroom covered in playboy pictures? 

Although it took my brain a second to shake off the whiskey, I soon realized that I was not hallucinating ... I was drinking at Kozy Kar.
author: Tom L.

description:
I'm going to have to say this is the best dive bar I've ever been to. If you are looking for a classy place or a date place, this is not your place. If you are looking for a totally ridiculous bar, like nothing you've seen before, and don't mind lots of nudity and some porn (on the screens), then you'll like this place. 

This place has 2 waterbeds. WATERBEDS in a bar - that's awesome.

They have a working pinball machine

They have an entire half of a 80s "conversation" van - that you can sit in - awesome.

They have an empty hot tub you can sit in.

Yeah, it's not the cleanest, but you come to this place to get dirty - metaphorically and literally, I guess.
author: Barry S.

description:
Whoa.

This bar would wreck shit in Portland. Seriously. Portland hipsers would piss their super-tight peg-leg purple pants over this place. 

A bar modeled after a badd-ass 1970's Dodge Van? Oh yeah. Think metallic orange and green puffy vinyl walls, a water-bed up front (and I believe another in back), light fixtures made from chain-link steering wheels and hubcaps, various accoutrements like van grills and ladders on the walls, and from what I hear, an actual dodge van in the back. Oh, and a giant acrylic bong on the wall (for decoration purposes). Combine this with some badass tropical sunset wallpaper and friendly staff, and what do you get? Well, something that's totally Rawesome. (Rawesome = Rad + Awesome) in concept, and pretty damn kool in execution. 

The bar itself serves a mix of bottom-shelf booze, Ameican macro-brews, and box wine (to add to that 1970's drinkin'-in-the-van chic). This is cool and all, but it's also the one factor that would keep me from coming back over and over again. Call me pretentious if you will, but there's a reason they call that stuff "rot-gut" booze. Cheap ingredients do a body bad. I've done my time in the trenches with Olympia, and while I'll still drink it on a lark, I wouldn't find myself angling for it every day. 

This is definitely a place to stop in, check out the scene, and have a campy good time. The decor alone is so tubular it makes me want to stay, but the lack of anything meaningful above bottom-shelf would drive me to drink... elsewhere, on a regular basis. 

That said, Kozy Kar has it's appeal, and deserves 4-stars for such a gnarly idea.
author: Don B.

description:
Bow chicka wow wow! 

Awe sooky sooky... the shag wagon reminds me of the Scooby doo van the Mystery Machine. Yeahhh baby! 

The Olympia, Fat Tires (bleh), PBR, and Schlitzes in a can are $4 bucks a piece so I must just do a Bacardi and cola. Yeah, Do it, do it. 

The only thing missing are the lava lamps baby. 

Nice stop for a Polk streer bar crawl.
author: Earl G.

description:
You guys must check out this new bar. It's designed with cool 70's rapey van decor and paraphernalia. 

Playboy centerfolds from the 70's and 80's (with full bush) plastered all over the bar counters and floors, shag and sparkly vinyl walls, chain stearing wheel light fixtures, CB Radios in the booths allowing you to call other booths... "that's a big 10-4 buddy", Eight track players, chairs from 70's kustom vans, mirrored ceilings, water beds... yes, WATER BEDS and all sorts of the other glorious 70's white trash charm. 

They even serve Hamm's, Schlitz and Olympia beer (not that I'm a big fan of either but it brings back 1970's / 1980's memories of my drunken relatives).

Vodka-soda's were only $5 (and I believe their well vodka was Absolut.  The only downside was they don't have Ketel One vodka...  Update: They now have a shitload of Ketel One AND Fernet http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TqPNHkYhk3t-hUPQHW2JVA?select=tRsxKjffXPIed-gqeeht1g

I see a Magnum P.I. 'stache and a Trans Am (like Smokey and The Bandit) in my near future.

Two thumbs up to Sam and crew for this slick new bar!!! 

Just look for the Hasbro Light-Brite sign on Polk and Sacramento.

Also, perhaps go early to avoid the frat douches that seem to infiltrate, conquer and seize all of the new SF spots.

Update:
I think it's hilarious that people are 1-starring KK because... (drum roll) there's a line to get in... to a new bar... on a weekend... go figure??? 

Perhaps I should give Kokkari a 1-star review because I couldn't find parking closer than 3 blocks away on a Friday night and the couple sitting next to us were of the douchey nature? 

As for the crowd, what would you do? Be selective about who you let in? Last time I checked San Francisco is in friggin' America, home of the free. WHY DO YOU HATE AMERICA?

I guess they could make it like a club where they could have a velvet rope and pick and choose who they let in and who has to wait but then you would complain about not being let in because you're fat, ugly or you're mama dresses you funny.  It's a lose / lose situation. 

Solution: Either get there early, go on a weeknight or just wait for the new bar smell to go away.
author: Thömas F.

description:
Great concept bar, for sure. I really love seeing someone take an idea as wacky as a '70s van themed bar, and totally running with it.

Some of the things you can expect from a visit to Kozy Kar:

-Cheap beer, wine in boxes, friendly bartenders
-Steering wheels and hub caps on the ceiling
-Working CB radios that let you communicate with other booths around the bar
-8 track players
-Water beds!
-Weekend douchebaggery

If I can give one word of advice, it's to avoid this place at all costs Thursday-Saturday. Other than that, head on in and have a ball. One of the more unique experiences around San Francisco.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I haven't laughed so much in a bar since I was young, impressionable and found frat boys attractive.

Kozy Kar was a random stop by some of the girls and the message I got by way of encouraging me to stop being a hermit and come out was...

"OMG KK....there is a water bed in this bar! A WATER BED!!!! And porn, you can't forget the porn...oh! and the naked playboy chicks! yeah!!
*random shuffling sounds and giggling*.......You should absolutely come out and meet up with us!! You HAVE to see this place"

Of course my sense of adventure and curiousity being piqued I decided to splash on a little perfume, gloss my lips, tease my hair and sashay out to this little gem on Polk.

So what else can I say that others haven't?

This place was hilarious in its kitschy decor, and the shagtastic waterbed with its shag carpeting made me want to rock the boat all night long. It was an open invitation all night for strangers to come chat and snuggle with us as there seems to be something about a waterbed that connects us all (perhaps a Freudian inference to being in our mothers' wombs in amniotic fluid?? too weird? yeah, my bad).

The beers were cheap, the wine came from a box. The music was a blend of 70s disco  and rock (Bee Gees, Abba, Queen) and the bathrooms took care of any modesty issues you may have had quickly.

Lots of cute boys and the bartenders were really friendly and quick.

One of my new fave places to people watch while sailing on the high seas of the waterbed....
author: Kathy K.

description:
cheap, strong drinks. refurbished vw vans as booths. retro videos, music, and decor. what more could you ask for? 

as visitors, we ended up here on the reccommendation of a bartender from the Pour House (since they dont offer full bar) -  this place turned out to be much more up our alley.

By far a highlight of our pub-crawling while in SF was Kozy Kar.
author: Michelle A.

description:
If I could, I would put ZERO stars!! Went here last night with a group of European friends. Ordered some jäger bombs and my friend asked the bartender (TOM) if the drink that came with the shots was red bull, and the bartender yelled "NO SHIT" it is. I asked him why he's giving us attitude and he replied "I'M TIRED OF DEALING WITH FUCKING RETARDS LIKE YOU!" These were his exact words.Even if this was a stupid question, he had no right to yell at us. I am a bartender myself and I would NEVER EVER insult my costumers! I have been to soo many places in San Francisco and this is the first time EVER I have had a bartender insult me. 
I asked another bartender if I could speak to the manager and believe it or not, the extremely rude bartender was the manager! I will never ever go back to this place because I believe that no one should be able to insult costumers just because they asked a simple question.
author: Jenny J.

description: love this place! fun, good service, and nice staff. love coming here. always entertaining. what a clever idea for a bar. I hope they become a chain in most cities
author: Annie A.

description:
So here I am, one of the few people not completely going mental for Kozy Kar. That's fine, I'll be a rebel. I had a badass time here last night but that was the crowd I was with, not the bar. Me and the same folks would have had a five star time gettin down in the lobby of gas station. Seems like a pretty standard watering hole with a little shag carpeting, and also extremely heavy on the frat/bro crowd at that. Like reeeeallly heavy.

Naked ladies plastered all over the floor was a pleasant surprise. Scared the crap out of me when I finally noticed I had been walking over nudeness all night without even realizing. Bong on a pedestal is always a plus, like a relic on display at a church for all to worship.

Stripper pole was just not right, get it off the wall. What's the point of a pole if you can't even spin around? Geez.. Sure, they let you climb all over it if you like but you can't start making those dollar bills if there's a one foot gap before you hit the wall.

I felt tingly inside since they hit the Holy Trifecta of Milwaukee beers: PBR/Schlitz/Olympia. Well, until they ran out of Schlitz anyway. Bartenders were cheerful and attentive. 

I came home feeling like it was an amazing place but like I said, once I really thought it through I had an amazing time because of the peeps I was there with, not the bar. Just not my deal I guess, I'll come here to drink with people if they want but you won't catch me kickin it here on the regular.
author: Justin N.

description:
Best thing, puppy behind the bar!  She is a doll too, go pet her!!!

As far as ambiance, there are porn mag pages COVERING the floor...seriously...it's weird.  While I was peeing...there were naked women starring at me, I felt violated.  The also play OLD SCHOOL TV shows (like Brady Bunch era) and there are random porn scenes flickering through.  Imagine, Mr. Brady giving Bobby a chat about growing up and how heartfelt it is and the warm feeling you would get when Bobby would feel better and then BAM...naked people go-in at it.  SO WEIRD.

There is a water bed you can lay in up front, didn't try it but it looked dope!  The seating is all different all over, cool set ups all around.  With the decor it felt dirty but it wasn't too bad.

The bartender was super nice and that is a huge plus even if I could only take the vibe for an hour...or maybe it was the naked women starring at me... hmmmm... the world may never know....
author: Colleen B.

description:
Perhaps I was a little biased on my previous visit.  

Perhaps the fact that I made $1.25 on the stripper pole, got to hang out with Ruggy, and got sucked into the waterbed hype made me see this place through rosier glasses.

Perhaps it's because I came on a Wednesday.

Nope, I just like this place.  A group of us came here on a Saturday night, and got here early enough to take over the two booths that are next to the waterbed in the back.  Eventually we lost one of them because we weren't paying attention, but that's fine.  We can share.  

I got to wear my rollerskates for a little while (although I was told to take them off for safety reasons), got some love from my new favorite bartender, and just really enjoyed myself.  

I know people complain about the douchiness, but that's going to happen everywhere.  I swear they are breeding.  

People also complain about the line outside, but it makes the inside a LOT less crowded, which as someone who was in there early, I was appreciative.

Moral of the story?  Come early, with good friends, stake out your claim, and ignore everyone else.
author: Pam S.

description: My girls and I had an amazing time here Thursday night. Porn on the tv, naked ladies on the walls and floors, waterbeds and the red tint make for a perfectly raunchy experience. The bartender was awesome and we had a fab time, thanks Jack!
author: Alex N.

description: I love this place. The bartenders are all super nice and the drinks are still normal priced. The vibe is super funky and fun. Probably one of my favorite bars in SF.  I don't know why I don't go there more often!
author: Gina I.

description:
It's my new favorite bar in San Francisco! Nice staff, cheap drinks but go for the authentic, retro '70s decor and ambience. Booths are recycled "love shack" van seats, cut-in-half hot tubs and waterbeds covered in shag carpet. Get the party started on a water bed booth for real fun. Place attracts wide range of locals, 
but turns very "Marina Hipster" about 10 p.m.
author: Suzanne K.

description: This was our third stop on our now at this point literal bar crawl. I didn't actually order from the bartender, but my friend got me three/four shots of "the cool aide" or was it juice. Hell I don't remember, but it tasted good! We got the water bed right by the front door. I did feel like there was a certain amount of uh, gross everywhere. A real dive if you ask me! I did get to venture to the back and saw more randomness everywhere. Way to packed for me to try to get a round of pinball. It was cheeky and fun. Only in San Francisco!
author: Desiree Y.

description:
I pass by the billboard for this place every day on my route to work and have always been ridiculously confused as to what to expect, so I had to try it.
4 stars literally only because it was stinky and the more people that came, the worse it got. The water bed was a little gross too, but a good scrub down in the shower never hurt anyone. 
Service was ridiculously fast I barely finished my order before another bartender asked if I've been helped! 
Super perfect place to take picky guy friends who are over the marina but want nothing fancy! 
I'll be back! Love you Polk street!
author: Kristina B.

description: I don;t know why, but I find it really hard to love this place... It certainly has its charm - and the car seats are really cool. But it can be hard to find places to sit as they are all fixed and there aren't many chairs to move around. Worth checking out though, I know  a lot of people who love it more than me.
author: Kai-Ashley C.

description:
It's all been said before but...



 How can you not love a place where you can sit in a waterbed, a jacuzzi, drink, and watch 80's movies with splices of porn? Hilarious. 


Yeah, it's a dive bar but it does it well.
author: Melissa S.

description:
One of my all-time favorite SF bars.  This place is decadent and kitsch, and one of those places that really has a solid SF vibe.  It screams "I'm enjoying myself and I don't care what you think about it."

Horizontal from eye level it is a normal, though somewhat tacky hot-rod themed bar.  Very "Route 66" with the stools and booths that look like the back of an old cadiallac or a microbus.  Look up or down, however, and you will see that the floor and ceiling are covered in centerfolds.  Also of note, they play old 70s movies or cartoons, and every few minutes splice in a few seconds of hardcore porn.  Just enough to make you say, "wait, what?"

The music is great, the prices are low, and I feel this place consistently provides a laid-back good time.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Dear Sam,

More stars just for your humor ;)  Nicely done.

- Candy

http://www.mazeltovproductions.com/stupidreviews.htm
author: Candy C.

description:
I love the concept of this place! Cool 70s decor with nude playmates pinups on the floor and bar, stripper pole, disco ball, and of course, the van against the wall with car seats and waterbed in the back.

I didn't get the chance to try the waterbed at the front, but I hopped in the one in the back and hung out for awhile. Also I had a couple of cheap ass beers, PBR and Schlitz ($3 each). I don't think that they had anything on tap.

For a Wednesday night, it wasn't crowded at all. Bartenders were nice and I got my drinks right away. I'm sure on the weekends, it's crazy especially since it just opened. If you want to check this place out, come during the weekdays!
author: Rhoda G.

description:
Kozy Kar is a perfect example of what makes Polk Street so quirky and fun -- a dive with the sensibility of a creative mind. The place is tiny, like seriously almost single-file tiny, but it's hard to be too upset with all the vintage porn that is floating around you on the walls. 

Cheap drinks, cool seats (if you can find them), fun atmosphere.
author: John C.

description:
I love this place!!

Naked Barbies, Peeing Babies, Bongs, Water Beds, Rotating Booths, Shag Carpet, Retro Cartoons, Boxed Wine, Dildos...this place is amazing!

The bartenders are nice, the drinks are cheap, and the patrons aren't douchey.

Just a little FYI for the shy though: the bathroom stalls don't have doors, just curtains...PEEK-A-BOO! ;)
author: Allison L.

description:
Not for the faint of heart, and here's why:

- Porn intermixed with old school rock excerpts playing on the TVs
- Naked  women cutouts acted as wallpaper on a wall and lined the floor in the back area

PROS:
- A lot of personality: places to sit included an empty hot tub and car seats
- $5 drinks, stiff
- Relaxed music

CONS:
- Not too crowded on a Wednesday night
- Divey atmosphere
author: Stephanie T.

description: I met up with a friend real quick here. As I entered the aroma of citrus, and weed filled my nostrils. This place is definitely a dive bar, with interior of vintage pornagraphic images, car parts, shag and whatever else lining the walls. I didn't want to touch anything and if I did I would proceed to wash my hands. Oh which was lovely because the bathroom had no soap! The restrooms stalls have curtains which close but have a wonderful slit down the side, which allow people to peer in if they'd like. Wtf? Invest in some doors! Porn is shown on the televisions throughout the bar mixed with vintage commercials. I was disappointed at the lack of porn variety, where is the interracial gangbang, college, casting couch, or crack whore confessions?! Interesting bar to try but I don't think I would want to consistently hang out here.
author: Kis S.

description:
Came here twice in the past few weeks and was HOPING on a friday that people would utilize the dance floor! and that they would PLAY good music that's worthy of booty shaking!!

Sorely disappointed!! SO i have ruled it out as a dance spot BUT on to regular bar review. Obviously the decor is fun! How can one go wrong with centerfolds, waterbeds, CB radios, etc?! 
The drinks are expensive for the area, we payed $3 for a PBR!! Im sorry but they average $0.50 at a grocery store! I will never pay over 2 for PBR at a bar. My friend ordered a well whiskey coke and it was $7. and she said it was not that strong. SO i am glad i was already drunk when i arrived!! The music selection was a big snore.

I would come here on a week night with a group but ixnay on the weekend play!!
author: Susanna B.

description:
This place is gross and weird. I hate it.

I go to Polk all the time, but have only been here once. 

It's insanely can't-move-or-breathe crowded. Full of literally stinky people...literally, eww.

My friend liked it, so I stomached a horrible drink, their well must be lighter fluid (I know, my fault for ordering a well drink, but I didn't want to spend any money here). And put on a smile...ish.

Yes it has furry walls, and yes it has weird 70's style parts of cars you can sit in. That to me does not mean it's a fun place. 

I wouldn't touch the furry walls though. Lots of sweaty stinky people are rubbing themselves on them.

The only kind of plus is that they have bendy straws. That will be the one star, I guess. 

I felt dirty when I left. Never coming back.
author: Brittany P.

description:
The Kozy Kar has perfected the intentional-dive-bar genre. The beers are cheap, the bartenders are amazing, and the atmosphere is lovingly engineered to make you feel like you could, without regret, spend the rest of your life drinking PBR on a waterbed in a van in the back section of a dark dive in Polk Gulch. 

The only hesitation I have about giving the Kozy Kar 5 stars is that part of me wants to write a rod-up-my-keister one-star review to get an excerpt up on the billboard across the street.
author: Mike O.

description:
Worst bar I've ever been to.   DO NOT frequent this locale.

I had the unfortunate idea of taking my friends to Kozy Kar because it was a place on Polk I hadn't been to before.  It was a HUGE MISTAKE.  

My friends and I ordered drinks and I sat on an empty seat at the bar.  I was sitting there for at least half an hour when two girls (one with frizzy blonde hair and her friend) come back and say they want to sit there.  I just thought it was weird because who comes and asks to take your seat at a bar???  Anyway, they could have sat next to me on the seat-bench but they chose not to.  

So, they complained to some bartender (said his name was "Mattie" - red shirt - tattooed arm) that liked them and then about fifteen minutes later he comes to my friend and I and VERBALLY ABUSES at us.  So this tyrant screams at us and says:  When some of my customers that I serve want their seats you need to get  F!$#$%$ off the seats and give them to them.  You can finish up your F*^*&^ drinks and leave this F$#$*# bar!!!!!!!!!!  

We were like what?  We've been at this spot for about an hour now - what's your problem?  Can I speak to the manager?  

NO!!! YOU CAN FiNISH UP YOUR DRINKS AND GET THE F#$#$! OUT OF THE BAR!!  

So then my friend and I comment to each other maybe he's racist because we're Asian.  He then hears us and is like "No, I'm half-black.  You're the racist!"  
-Ok weirdo, you can still be racist no matter what race you are.  

Needless to say, I was and still am shocked, appalled, and disgusted.  My friend tried to close out the tab and I tried to tell some guy that said he was the owner.  But the owner guy didn't really seem to care that much - all he said was that he would talk to that guy.  Big deal - I didn't really even get an apology.  

Never going back there.  I knew it was a shady dive bar, but this place is even worst - it's the embodiment of TRASH with a capital T.
author: F K.

description:
This is only a 1-star review because I cannot figure out how to give negative stars.

I ordered a water because I was a designated driver for my friend's birthday party.  When I ordered a second water, the bartender ordered me to leave the bar, claiming I was rude.  The remaining 5 party members left shortly thereafter.

This behavior is utterly unacceptable in any business and down right dangerous for a bar.  I was attempting to behave responsibly and ensure the safety of myself and the rest of my group, a point that seemed beyond the comprehension of the feeble-minded bartender.  Instead of the appreciation I deserve for not drinking, I was rudely evicted and our party ended on a rather sad note.

Will not return, will not let a friend attend in the future.
author: Daniel K.

description:
80s movies mixed with soft porn. Laminated playboy centerfolds on the floor. Ghetto booths for stashing your purse, your drink and your date. Sweet jams, with hella 80s/90s music. Prime Polk street location, equidistant to the douchier (sorry, "classier") Russian hill bars and the dodgier TenderNob dives.

Quick tip: girls are not allowed in the boys bathroom. In case you were wondering.
author: Amanda F.

description:
I had a good time at this bar, everytime..
Not once was I ever like this place is putting me to sleep.
More like the complete opposite. Ive had hearty pours and some solid talk with the senior staff there.. Cool kats..
I love the VW buses in back with the interconnected cb radios. And seein a wasted gal step up to the pole and have at it in a drunken attempt is always appreciated..
Ahhh.!! And I cant forget the quality music for the theme, and videod.
Course ill be going back.!!
author: Alfonzo T.

description: Hahahah. This place is the bomb dot com--not where you bring your grandma when she comes to town but definitely a good time if you're in the neighborhood. Always stop here when I'm in town. Drinks are priced decently and it's a dive bar through and through--with a minor twist: the porn-theme. Some might be a little thrown off but it's a good time, so get over yourself and have a good time hanging out in the different booths, be it an old jacuzzi, schoolbus or race car.
author: Grace M.

description:
Words to survive by: Just pet the furry wall and all will be okay. 

This place is an 80's fungasm of beer, nudity and somehow sanitary waterbeds. The Lite Brite sign beckons you in from the cold of Polk, promising something no other bar along the Gulch can offer. 

The way in, a bottle neck that can break the toughest of Marina men, but bust through the seemingly unending wall of idiots who don't understand the concept of a fire hazard and enter a cave of wonders...

Shellacked Centerfolds for flooring, Shaggin' Wagons turned into booths, with slowly rotating seating, TVs on the walls playing clips of old commercials from a childhood you vaguely recall, but now long for in that fleeting grasp at your once forgotten innocence upon seeing Kid Sister, My Buddy, Log, Slinky and more spliced with Fight-Clubian snippets of porn (sort of an nymphish smack in the face from the owner for being naive enough to think you can go home again. Although it seems that's all this dive is about.)

Enjoying a beverage on one of two waterbeds in a room that gives you the feeling of being caught in a nightmare version of Spicoli's bedroom. And stay till closing so as to get assaulted by the staff that you need to leave now as it's almost 2AM, when you phone clearly states 1:40AM, but hey, it's all part of the draw, and it may take another 20mins to make it out thru the bottleneck to fresh air. 

And yeah, I keep returning.
author: Kelly S.

description: The kitschiest, shag carpet-est, windowless "grape" van, dive bar I have ever seen.
author: Scott P.

description:
Kozy Kar is the bar on Polk Street you go to piss people off. It just has that effekt on the world and that's sort of inkredible. I've been here a lot and I refuse to get drunk every time. I just don't trust the klientele. Maybe I feels weird about all the centerfolds around me. The waterbeds were Kool and the drinks were modest in koin.
Uhh, I guess this is my starter bar on a good night.
Nothin' wrong about that!
author: Alexander R.

description:
Since I cannot always drink Schlitz tall boys whilst lounging on the waterbed in the back of my '75 Chevy Short, the Kozy Kar exists.

A more awesome place there has never been.
author: Niko Z.

description:
I've been here twice now, both nights were slightly above average but nothing extraordinary to write home about. You can count on Kozy Kar for a reliable, good night. 

I would suggest making Kozy Kar just a stop on your Polk St pub crawl and not the main attraction. 

Apparently the TVs show porn all night? Perhaps it was the strong drinks or perhaps my boyfriend is lying to me because I have no recollection of this.
author: Johanna W.

description: If you're not looking for it, you may miss it among all the happenings on polk street.  Nevertheless it's a fun bar to dive into.
author: Ameer N.

description:
FYI. There are boobs everywhere.....

On the ceiling, on the bar, on the TV screens...

Ran up a tab, nearly passed out on the water bed in the front and had a blast. 

Alcohol and boobs...What more could anyone ask for?
author: Shy A.

description:
Fun!

I was forewarned about the 70's porn theme. For a friends bday 2 weeks ago we went to dinner at sushi rock and then walked across the street to Kozy Kar. 

Bathrooms: kind of small, no doors, just curtains. Have a friend stand in front of it so you don't get yourself in an awkward situation. 

Drinks: SO STRONG, but good.

Everybody had a really good time. We got onto the water bed for awhile and hung out. (its tough to get out of..esp after the strong drink and wearing a short skirt)

I might have to come back next week to celebrate my birthday!
author: Saria M.

description: Please avoid this bar. They let their drunk patrons stand outside the bar yelling homophobic and racist comments at passers-by.
author: Chris Y.

description:
The decor, the "wall paper", the videos, and the waterbeds make the place perfect.  

Love it, love it, love it.
author: Cullen R.

description:
This place is awesome. A friend of mine and I stumbled across it while barhopping on Polk St. and decided to go in because it looked like a place we normally wouldn't go. The outside looks a little sketchy but it definitely isn't a bad place on the inside.

The waterbed covered in a shag rug was awesome. We spent most of the time we were there on that and meeting new people and sharing the bed with them. There was also a ton of 70s playboy posters on the walls, and there was a small TV screen in the wall playing porn and maybe some news? And porn. And a movie. And porn. 

Awesome music playing all the time. 

Bartenders and the bouncer were all chill people and great to talk to. 

Great atmosphere. This will definitely become a regular spot for me and my friends!
author: Anne S.

description:
This place is awesome. There's porn on the floor and bar counter, and every once in a while it'll pop up on the tv. There are waterbeds, and drinks are pretty cheap. It also has a dance floor, and quite a few people were dancing when I was there. 
Overall the atmosphere is very relaxed and fun.
author: Ariana L.

description:
Every time I think about Kozy Kar, I get really sad. This bar is off-the-charts weird; I truly feel at home when I'm pounding a PBR while people-watching at KK. There's nothing more genuine than the look of horror that overtakes a Mayes girl's face after she inadvertently stumbles into here.

Alas, two Halloweens ago, a dude in a Darth Vader costume physically chased me out while swinging his lightsaber at me. I barely made it out alive. As a result, I feel like I can't come back until the management team can offer assurances of my safety.
author: Leo K.

description:
Funky interior modeled to look like a car, water beds, and pictures of naked chicks everywhere.  Couple this with extremely strong drinks and you have the perfect place to start off a night of drinking on Polk.  I was there on a Friday night and there was room to breath, on a Saturday I'm not so sure.  The only strange thing was everyone I saw dancing.....definitely couldn't dance.

Oh well, this place is definitely one to check out on your Polk St rounds.
author: Ryan J.

description:
A good place to get a drink during the week. It's not overly crowded, the bartenders are friendly, and you can actually have a conversation with the person next to you. I know this place gets pretty packed on a weekend, so the vibe isn't exactly as I just described, but still a fun weekend hangout too.

There are waterbeds (I don't trust them so I don't sit on them), pictures of naked chicks EVERYWHERE (not really impressive to me, but whatever, it's unique), old movies playing on their TV's (if you look closely you'll see old porn cut right into the movies), and the list really does go on with all the funny stuff you see inside this bar. Not your typical bar that's for sure.

I was very impressed by the decor of the place. It really does have the feel of being inside one of those old vans. Even the light fixtures were made out of car parts. Someone definitely got creative here.

I'll come here for a drink or 2, but wouldn't stay here the whole night.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Only in San Francisco - that's what echoes through my head when I go to this bar.  It features such amenities as a faux fur covered water bed, a bar that's covered with 80s porno pictures and tv's that play movies that have porno movie scenes spliced in between normal movie scenes (car crash to a blow job is always an attention grabber).  On top of that, they have a self deprecating ad on a billboard across the street that serves as a pseudo warning to those who dare to enter.  Hilarity ++.  Drinks are fine, though I wish the gin + tonics had just a wee bit more gin, but the price seems just right.

Kudos to the bar owner for creating something absolutely unique even if it's not going win the hearts of everyone.
author: Jan S.

description:
Great bar.   Love the decor and especially the waterbed in the front.  We took it over and made it ours for the night.  It's a good spot to be because the end of the bar goes right to the waterbed, so you don't have to get up and try to push through all the other people waiting for drinks.
Drinks were strong, bartenders took good care of us, we had a great night.
author: Lauren W.

description: This place is not for the shy. This is a porn bar. Yes, you read that right- porn. There are pictures of naked women and people having sex on the television screens. Its a very narrow bar, with dark tables in the back and a (very dirty) waterbed in the front- cant say ive ever seen that at a bar before! The drinks are prices reasonably ($7 for a jack and coke) and the bartenders are very pleasant (a definite plus!) Im not all for dingy, divey, dark bars which is why I give it a 3 (the bathrooms have curtains instead of doors.....)
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
Drinks are not crazy expensive, that's a plus. The downside is that they pack that place like a container ship. Honestly, we were there on a Friday night and it was fire-code breakingly packed. There's a difference between a place being "close" and "cramped."

Number 2, the bouncer was kind of a dick. I mean, oh well, if they weren't dicks they wouldn't be bouncers, now would they? But this guy was pretentious on top of it, was hostile to my very well meaning friend. Was reading a snooty book at the door and flexing his ego. Boo this man.
author: Jay C.

description:
FUN 70's Feel.
Waterbed
Fuzzy shag on the walls
Decent Drinks
Disco Ball
Fenders on the wall
Old-School Car seats at the bar
Booths set up like the inside of a van
Playboy centerfolds on the dance floor
Soft-core on the tv's
Probably a good place to take someone who 
grew up ( and enjoyed ) that era.
author: Krista K.

description:
I'm a kitsch queen.  If' it's tacky and cheesy, I'm usually all about it.  For instance, I have a huge collection of kitschy Jesus stuff (p.s. I'm a Jew), collect old pulp novels, and make a special point of going to every terrible roadside attraction I can see (world's biggest thermometer anyone?).  So when someone described Kozy Kar to me, I thought I had found my bar niche.  

Sadly, Kozy Kar and I were not meant to be.  I just feel like the bar is trying too hard to be quirky and different.  The crowd is also a little odd, and the few times I have been there, people have gotten really aggressive and fights have almost broken out. 

Oh, and my beer was warm every time, which just is not right.

But one extra star for the old porn pics.  I loved those.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
The boyfriend wanted to celebrate his birthday with some friends, so we decided to venture to Polk Street...neither of us have spent a whole lot of time in this area.

We found the Kozy Kar with the help of other Yelpers. Upon entering, I immediately felt like I had walked into an episode of That 70's Show. The bar tenders were friendly and the drinks were reasonable. $3 for select beers, and $5 for all well drinks. I enjoyed sitting in an RV style car while chatting with friends. The waterbeds kinda freaked me out. What happens in those dark corners? And the shag carpeting covering the bed? Ewww.

Kozy Kar does porn tactfully- if that's even possible. The pin-up girls are on the floor and the bar- with just a few framed photos hanging around the joint. Couldn't get over the intermittent porn that flashed throughout clips like "School House Rock." I'll admit, it kept my attention, I kept waiting to be caught off guard.

The Kozy Kar is a fun place to start your night- but I'm not sure it's a place I'd venture back to out of sheer desire to do so. It's certainly an experience though!
author: Annalise F.

description:
I'll never forget the first time I saw a money-shot out of the corner of my eye in the middle of a conversation with a friend. It happens so fast, you think you're seeing things.

Along those lines, I'll never get tired of bringing friends here, and having them go "was that just a moneyshot!?"

"Hmm, interesting. I don't think so, but... let's take... a closer... look-HEYO!"

The dance floor (covered in nude babes!) isn't really a dance floor, but I love the soundtrack though.
author: Ben C.

description: Waterbed!! is probably the only cool thing in there, other than that it looked like an orgy bar.
author: Amy R.

description:
"Shorty had on apple bottoms jeans and...there wereTVs with the fur...fur!"  

So, this bar was pretty cool, I love the retro 1970s feel to it. The fur around the TVs were a nice touch. I was pretty tipsy & giggly by the time I got here, so thats why it probably looked so cool. lol. 

Drinks were decently priced. My Long Islands were STRONG and got me on the path to being drunk. (Thank you to the oh so cool bartender, with a heavy hand!) 

But, my roommate and I had a  good time here. We'll def. be going back!
author: Lauren H.

description: A cool vintage 70's themed bar. I love that the seating areas include an empty jacuzzi and the inside of a van with a waterbed inside. The drinks are good and they come with bendy straws :)  It never gets too crowded. There's a small section for a dancefloor. They lose points for the ladies restroom being disgusting when I went. Oh and they have several tv screens where you can watch porn clips...I don't know if it's a negative or a positive...
author: Ashlee H.

description:
Ironic that a bar with a porn motif employs bartenders who don't know how to make a proper Slippery Nipple, but I guess there are worse things in the world.

Kozy Kar was my birthday bar destination, and I think it was ultimately a good decision. I can't really imagine anything better than rolling around on a water bed, drunk, while wearing a dress made out of silver sequins. Said water bed is located right at the bar entrance, so if you're wearing a dress and in such a state as I was, you're sure to flash your goodies at every single person as they come and go. Many pictures were taken that night, so if you're lucky, maybe you'll see a crotch shot on the bathroom floor!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Came here by accident and I'm glad I did. Stiff drinks, cheap prices, sarcastic bartenders and bizarre interior. I have never seen a bar like this and I have been to many, many bars across the land.

Thursday night is by far and away the best night. The two bartenders who work are hilarious and for some reason love to give out shots of Jewish wine and Fernet.

Very fun, strange and funny all at the same time.
author: maggie C.

description:
Here's a wrap up of Kozy Kar:

friendly security guard loved our dirty bacon dogs and could smell it a block away.

walked in and there was a musty smell from the crowd in the bar due to limited ventilation 

ooh and ahhed at the 70s porn decor and the neon retro feel of the place

waterbeds, shag beds, and champagne rocks

music is ehh... 70s, 80s, 90s  recordings

Overall,. Maybe take an out of towner here because it's so unique.I would not frequent this bar regularly.
author: Kelly C.

description: Porn, nostalgic toys and strong drinks....Yes please!  This place is always a lot of fun.  It's a dive bar on steroids from the 80's :)
author: Brian S.

description:
Upsides: Unique atmosphere, fun and comfy seats, relatively cheap prices. Reminded me of half the bars in Portland, Oregon.

Downsides: No beer on tap (bottles only). 

Downside/upside?: The little TV screens around the place sometimes show porn (it's a little too obvious to be "subliminal"--the TV alternates between sports and porn, or children's cartoons and porn). If I was trying to impress a lady on a first date, I may not bring her here, unless I knew she was okay with unexpectedly getting a face full of gigantic cock.
author: Tamara F.

description: You guys rock my 70's pornographic world! Kozy Kar always loves to lure me in with her strong ass drinks, naked beauties and great mood lighting. I can never miss this hot spot when venturing Polk. After a few very stiff drinks (try the infamous slushee punch in particular) you may find yourself getting kozy on top of a water bed with a cute hipster, or you may chat it up with the mixologists, none the less it's always a guaranteed GOOD time! Now, the only reason I left off one star was because of the leaky H20 bed at the front -beware of that one Yelpa's!
author: Mya C.

description:
Ugh.  What to say about this place?  Frankly, the decor is pretty awesome, they obviously put alot of work into it.  That right there garners a 2 star rating, but the crowd there was such crap: frat boy, popped collar, Marina douche-bags.  The kind of horrible ignorati that actually think people are as lame as they are, thus the two 'bro' conversations I got in at the bar while ordering drinks (about the lack of 'hot pu**y' at Kozy Kar and the Stanford game [of course]).  we finished my can of PBR, cause there is nothing on draft, unanimously voted, and we all left.

There's no reason to ever return, however, if you're in the hood before 9 pm, before the crowds get there, the decor is worth checking out: germ infested waterbeds, rape vans, and 70's videos on loop with porn spliced in.
author: Joe V.

description:
Would give it 0 stars if I could.

Chris Rock performed a skit called "Progress Report"  tracking the social progress of African-Americans through triumphs and blunders. For example, "General Colin Powell speaking at the Republican Convention marched us twelve steps ahead." But we can't celebrate just yet because, "Mike Tyson speaking in public set us twenty-four steps back!"

Kozy Kar is like twenty-four steps back for women.  Women going to and promoting Kozy Kar is like fifty steps back.
author: Jamie E.

description:
Kitschy. 

While the massive leather bar seats are cool and comfortable, they are really annoying too, because a) if you're sitting in one, it's constantly getting swiveled and bumped and turned as people try to edge past or to the bar and b) they are extremely hard to squeeze around when trying to get a drink. The aisle between the wall and the bar is toooooo small. If you are not lucky enough to be lounging in one of the bar seats, you will be forced to deal with a constant stream of people trying to squeeze past you - you'll either be squished up into your friend's lap then, or sucking it in against the wall. Poor design. 

The music is ridiculously loud too. Forget any attempts at conversation. And not only is it loud - it sucks. 

Poor beer selection to top it all off. Can't even get drunk the way I want to!
author: Kristyn M.

description:
The highlight of my brief stay here was the 70's porn decor they've got going on. They've got a bed in the corner which is neat, except the placement of it is all wrong. It's located to the left of the entrance right by the door, and underneath two windows. The incoming draft made it too cold to stay on the bed for long, but then again, I was sober. The music wasnt even remotely tempting to tap my feet to, and the crowd mostly uncoordinated douchebags, was definitely not stimulating enough. 
Cheap attempt to end on a positive note: They have nice bartenders!
author: Gabriella C.

description:
I may be a girl/woman/female... but I am not afraid to admit my love for porn. Not that HBO after hours soft core stuff... but actual penetration. So my attention was completely diverted from whatever conversation was going on with my friends when porn would intermittently pop up on the TV screens at Kozy Kar.  My friend Roger and I found ourselves starting at the TV like robots, hoping to catch that split second of pornography. 

To add more to the steamy factor of Kozy Kar, the floor is lined with playboy spreads from a time when women had pubic hair! 

I love the idea of this bar, the retro atmosphere.. water beds included. However, the music failed the mark a bit. As strong as they claim to hold a legendary 70's themed bar, the music was mostly 80s hair band and even 80s pop. Some good, yes, but gimme Zeppelin please. 

A wide mix of PBR lovers in this joint, though most of the men lacked height... tear for the tall girl staring at porn in the corner.
author: Hailey P.

description:
Went here last night for a bday party. A couple notes:
1) It was crowded beyond belief (think, 1130 on a saturday night).
2) This place was filled with giants. At 5'2", and wearing flats, I was eye-level with most people's waistbands. I kid you not.
3) Despite the crowd, it actually wasn't hard at all to get a drink at the bar.
4) Cool, kitschy decor.
5) Music was rather blah.

That is all.
author: Nora G.

description: How do I, the queen of white trash parties, not know about this place? Deceiving from the outside this trashy hole in the wall bar demands that you have fun. You can get a beer in a can in a beer kozy (a "Kozy Kar Kozy" get it?) or a strong drink. Seventies Playboy's  are lacquered onto the floor, old cartoons play on TV screens...you can choose to sit on a water bed (at your own risk) or in a drained out hot tub with all your friends.  This place makes you feel like throwing a Key Party, taking off your pants and dancing....I wouldn't take my mom here.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Get in my van. No really, get in...I've got beer, a water bed and burnt orange shag walls. 

Still not sold? 

Well, then maybe you shouldn't take a ride in my Kozy Kar. It's not just a bar, it's a trip. As a girl who digs kitsch and themes, I felt right at home in the van/booths with TVs projecting Evil Knievel's 1974 attempt to jump Snake River Canyon at Twin Falls, Idaho and a floor covered in bushy, tan-lined retro centerfolds. It's a bit divey and 100% over the top but I simply can't resist a radtacular jaunt to Kozy Kar for some Atari frogger on a Friday night.
author: Jane K.

description:
The Kozy Kar is the sort of bar you'd dream up with the guys around a BBQ.

You: "Hey, let's open a bar."
Friend 1: "Good idea, let's see.. it should have a retro theme"
You: "Nice, I like it.. with a couple good beers"
Friend 2: "For sure.. and a stripper pole!"
F1: "Hell yea!  A stripper pole and a 'friggen water bed!"
You: "Then we could cut up a bunch of playboy magazines and laminate them into the bar!"
F1: "Brilliant! And we could show 70's movies on the tvs'!"
F2: "Or, we could show 70's porn.."
(together) "70's movies with porn cut into them!"

As you wold expect, it turns out to be a really fun place to get a drink.  It also turns out to have a staggering lack of women who are neither lacquered or in grainy technicolor.

Great theme though.  I was here for a good hour with some friends and had a blast.  It's a bit far away from my house, but I'll be back.
author: Nathan M.

description:
it was insanely crowded! its to the point where you can't even get to the back of the bar, without knocking someones drink! i was only here for a bit, drink prices are legit.

i might be able to enjoy this place more if their wasn't so many people, but if its crowded get out!
author: Jaime D.

description:
So, Kozy Kar is cramped and over-crowded.  This is pretty much to be expected for a Saturday night on Polk, but I could barely breathe or turn around in this place. 

On the upside: cheap beer, super stiff drinks, and cheesy 70s pornos. 

I ordered my usual Sailor Jerry and Diet and when the bartender poured it (pretty much just rum, ice, and three splashes of soda) he topped it off with more rum and said "Have fun with that."  Word. I did.  Thanks, bar man. 

Bottom line: I don't know that I'd make Kozy destination, but I wouldn't hesitate to stop by here on my next Polk St stumble.
author: Kellie T.

description:
This place is a trip. 

Like, a Partridge Family kind of trip, just add booze. 

Hello, world, hear the song that we're singin'
C'mon get happy!
A whole lot of lovin' is what we'll be bringin'
We'll make you happy!

We had a dream, we'd go travelin' together,
We'd spread a little lovin' then we'd keep movin' on.
Somethin' always happens whenever we're together
We get a happy feelin' when we're singing a song.

Trav'lin' along there's a song that we're singin'
C'mon get happy!

Because you can't NOT be happy when you're lounging in revamped retro rides, sippin' on cheap beer, surrounded by folks just along for the fun. It's totally campy, so if you're not a big David Cassidy fan, you may as well keep on truckin' cause this just isn't going to be your kind of spot.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
This place has a cool concept. We totally scored the booth with the CB radio and the water bed. So when I called my friends to meet up, they weren't leaving. So we just met them here. 
When we walked in, the place was PACKED. So packed it took us FOREVER to cram through the crowd and get to this spot. I have to admit, I barely made it because I was stuck to the floor. 
Ok, so I understand the whole concept and the PBR in the can is fun and the little nic nac crap they have plastered over the walls is great too. But that's where the appeal is over for me. 
This place is so dirty! There is nothing sanitary about it. I can't even go into detail. If it's your kind of thing, more power to you. I had to leave after about thirty minutes so I could try to scrub off. Just gross.
author: Jena D.

description: So I read the reviews before I came here, and I was totally confused about the many mentions of pornography. And lo and behold, they actually play 5-10 second clips of hardcore porn on the television every minute. This was a shock for me, and my buddy, who's a pretty conservative religious guy, as I didn't want to freak him out. He seemed to be okay with it, and I thought it was more hilarious than anything else. I've also caught myself staring it when it does come on (because of the shock), and felt like people thought I was a perv. Anyways, pretty cool place, dance floor is tiny, the staff were nice, friendly, and fast. The type of women who were here on a Saturday night were not nice at all, but that's just from my own experience, which may or may not be the norm.
author: Phan H.

description:
Don't know why people are complaining about the owner. Talked to the guy unknowingly after he poured some of the cheapest and heaviest knob creek and bulliet shots I've ever seen. He's a graduated double major and was pretty attentive to the patrons. Decor isn't exactly my favorite, but they get a star for it for the clips of Apocalypse Now and The Flinstones smoking cigarettes. 

While it may not be your favorite style, you have to give them points for putting their heart and soul into going after their kitschy atmosphere, from the cb radios to the Nite-Lite sign outside.

While I see these posts about the owner responding to the more harsh reviews, yelp isn't an anonymous site. If you're going to exercise your right to give some flak, I don't see how someone giving you flak in return is entirely out of the question.

Oh, and it was kind of out of the way for me, but you can get there in 20 minutes on a bus from 16th st BART.
author: Spencer T.

description:
The most original bar I have been too!
-Train booths with brightly colored shag carpets and tv's playing 70's dance shows and have dirty porn shots every minute or so play for about 5-10 seconds. 
-Water beds
-Laminated porn floors and walls
-Mirror ceilings
-Cocktails were kinda pricey
author: Sierra B.

description:
OK - confession time.  I'm a friend of Megan D.  

Well not really a friend, because I've never met her.  But she and some other people were gonna check out Kozy Kar last Friday and she was kind enough to invite me.   Now I'm a complete sucker for 70s nostalgia and Megan always struck me as a funny, cool person, so naturally I accepted.  One time we got in to a heated argument about a burnt cat with broken legs, but that apparently was beer under the bridge at this point.  

I got held up at work and didn't get until 11, at which time there was a line of a dozen people and it was packed inside.  That's to be expected , but after getting inside after a quick 5 minute wait, I realized it would have better to just keep me waiting.  Place was packed, and considering the entry way is about 4' wide, that was not a good thing.  We're talking like shoulder to shoulder, no room to breathe.  Additionally, I was carrying a backpack with my gym stuff in it.  Pretty much a recipe for being bounced around like a fat kid on his first day of jr. high.  I looked for a korner (haha) to set it down at, but was seeing nothing.  

When I finally got up the bar, it was a weird scene.  All the seats were taken, but nobody was talking.  They seemed to be kind of mesmerized, although I'm not sure by what.  Maybe they'd never seen pictures of boobies before, who knows.  I'd planned to just have a couple beers since I had a fitness test the next morning, and this really confused me because there were no taps there.  I asked what beer they had, and the reply was "Olympia, PBR, and Schlitz".  I was about to say "...and?", but then realized that truly was it.  Yep.  3 beers.  Served in a lovely 12 oz can.  

Now the funny thing is I'm from Wisconsin and lived in Seattle for 5 years, so I know these beers quite well.  PBR makes my head hurt, Olympia is really watery with little taste, and Schlitz is the butt of all Wisconsin beer jokes.  I can see what they were going for with the theme, but there's a reason the latter two went out of business.  Call me crazy, but if the owner wants to offer "beers that sell", why not throw in High Life or MGD?  Those are my two fallbacks when nothing better is available, but really my point is I don't see how you can call yourself a 70s themed bar without draft beer of any kind.  This was a huge head-scratcher.  

I decided to just pass on the drink and spent a couple more minutes looking for my crew, but realized it just wasn't gonna happen, and decided to bounce.  I felt kinda jipped for not even seeing the decor they've put so much effort in to, but this bar has only been open a few weeks and this type of crowd on a Friday night was not shocking.  My plan was to come back on a weeknight when things were less harry and hopefully after they had some more offerings in the beer department, but based on the owner's comments here, it doesn't appear he's very open to suggestions for improvement.  

I understand starting a business involves tons of effort, frustration, and risk since I'm doing it myself, but it also requires discipline and self-control.  His latest comments here are borderline psychotic.  There are several successful bars in town that people love to rant about (Zeitgeist, Alembic, etc) both on Yelp and other sources, but those businesses don't feel the need to belittle their critics in order to make a point.   They have their silly rules, and you either accept them or decide not to go.  I'd expect a person who's supposedly had 18 years in the business and claims to have so much success to understand that, so my only conclusion is that this is his way of guerrilla marketing.  Well, you've picked your poison, so good luck with that.
author: John H.

description: Love this place.  Christians not allowed.  The drinks are stiff, bartenders are friendly, titties on the walls, floor, ceiling and in the restroom-you'll notice it when you're taking a piss. Did I mention Waterbed booths?  You may feel like you've traveled back in time into the 70's and in your past life you may have been a porn star.  It's okay, I was there too.
author: Sarah V.

description:
This place is cash mother fucking money. 

Big ups whoever the blessed soul is who thought of combining a 70's shaggin wagon style van with a bar on Polk street. I would vote for you if ran for office based on that alone.

The barstools are old van seats, they've got lots of pimped out old van furniture in the back and best part of it all is they actually have a fucking waterbed shored up all van style, just chillin right in the front of the restaurant. BIGTIME.

The bartenders are hella chill too, always down to hook it up proper with the drinks and get in on whatevers going down at the bar that night.
author: Tommy P.

description:
I like this place. Clever concept, cool van decor and nice bartenders. Sometimes the porno intercut with the 1970's commercials on the video monitors gets a little gross, but it seems meant in a humorous way. It IS pretty funny to see people's reactions when they're focused on an old Woodsy Owl commercial and BAM they get an eyeful of something completely different. 

I made a prediction when they first opened that they'd have a big problem with drunk patrons damaging their van gear, but everything's held up well other than the main van's waterbed, which has been removed. 

Thought the drink prices were comparable to other bars on Polk St. 

It's not the biggest space and gets PACKED on weekends, especially the narrow space between the bar seats and the wall, which stretches back to the dance floor/group seating. Best to check it out early evenings.
author: Barbara K.

description:
Its own proclamation that frat boy mentality is not allowed seems only to have acted as a LOUD mating call for all the douches in the land. Stay away. Far away.

PS. you're not a dive bar just because you serve shitty beer.
author: petals o.

description:
Fine, its cool. The concept is wonderful. But why the hell anyone would stand in a 100 yard line to get into a "BAR" is beyond me. If you are desperate to be crammed into an average nightspot with half of the marina douchebags this is your spot. Sabor was right, this town is a fucking sausagefest.

Ps I just read the website and noticed the comment about "the frat boy mentality is not  tolerated"....yeah that would be an Epic Mission Statement Fail.
author: Dru P.

description:
I'm gonna RY (Re-Yelp *TM Connie C) Ruggy: Oh. My. Gawwwwwwwww.

I foresee lots of krazy stories coming out of Kozy Kar. It is absolutely fantasmic. 

I've held back this review for nearly 48 hours, in fear that I will be nudging open the flood gates to the public who is unaware of this shagadelic spot, but I can't contain my love for this glorious 70's themed bar that serves up cheap ass beer. Was I even born in the 70's, you ask? You know a woman never reveals her age.

A bartop covered in 70's Playboy pinups, mirrored ceiling, stripper pole (which you can only do a 180 on), pleather seats with spinning wooden tables, and working CB radios... but the centerpiece of it all is a water bed that orgies can take place on (just keep your shoes off and clothes on please) which is only accessible by climbing over a back seat, or through a 2'x2' tinted window.

Oh, you bet I will be having an epic event here in the near future, and it will be one party in your pants that you won't forget even if you get knocked up and black out on the water bed in the back of the van.
author: Connie C.

description:
WTF. 

I felt like I was in a pinball machine at this place.  So crowded and so small and so terribly laid out.  

And WTF was up with all the naked women pics on the ground.  Gross, some of them needed to get a serious brazilian wax. 

I hate sweating in small places because other people's sweat gets on you - that's exactly what Kozy Kar guarantees. 

2-stars for fun music, and that's all.
author: Bhumika K.

description:
Sketchy, hilarious: Kozy Kar is a rambling 70s van wreck of kitsch, all fur booths and CB radios and lo-fi brews, and we rolled in and had a ball here. Sure, if your sensibilities are off-put by some of the seedier elements present, it's probably not going to be your favorite joint, but from where we stood this night, the biggest challenge turned out to be the segmented booths and hanging with our party-a-shambles. Say this: there's little doubt Kozy Kar knows who it wants to be. 

The booths include windows to peer in on your neighbors and fuzzed out van seating complementing retro tv excerpts and a festive period-specific soundtrack: it's not a polite proposition, but it's damn sure a riot.
author: Kevin N.

description:
I like the idea of Kozy Kar, but the place is seriously claustrophobic. There are only three booths (and maybe a few tables?), and they don't seat that many. My party was able to nab a table early, and people hovered over us the whole night. "Are you leaving?" "When are you guys planning to leave?"

The bar is right by the entrance and has four or five really wide cushioned seats... Comfortable if you're able to nab one. If not, be prepared to order your drink over someone's shoulder or squeezed between one of the bar seats. (If you're ever able to order a drink.) It seems like stools would have made a lot more sense, space-wise.

Trying to get by is an ass ache, as they placed drink counters opposite the bar. So if you want to get to the back of the bar, you're competing with people trying to order drinks on one side, and people maintaining conversations with their friends on the other. I know that bars often have this kind of layout, but it sucks for places that are as tiny as this. (I think there are some Yelp photos that can give you a pretty clear idea of what this looks like).

As others have mentioned, the bathroom stalls are separated by curtains rather than actual cubicles. When my friend told me the set up they had, I feared the worst. But I must have been pretty drunk, because it ended up not being so bad. That may also be why I didn't notice the reflective floors everyone else mentioned.

There's a waterbed right by two of the booths. At the time I thought it was a pretty cool feature, but thinking back, it probably would have made more sense to just put in another booth. One booth had easy access to the waterbed, the other booth had this tiny barnyard-door looking thing. In my drunkenness getting in and out, I accumulated a fair amount of scrapes and bruises. There was a huge puddle in the middle of the waterbed... No one was really sure whether the thing was leaking, someone spilled their drink, or someone couldn't make it to the curtain toilets in time, but it was pretty nasty regardless.

The wide open space between the bar and the booths was the least claustrophobic, and it's worth a mention, because that huge amount of space usually doesn't exist in other dive bars (you know, because they have tables there instead). I guess this was like a dance floor?

The drinks were good, the prices were normal, the decor is amusing, the four bartenders were worked like dogs, there are naked titty designs all over the place... But I hate clown car bars like this. Especially since the place could have been more comfortable if they hadn't put priority in the decor. I couldn't believe there was actually a line to get in. It's great for the novelty, but I would never be a regular here.
author: Trish B.

description:
Who ever thought of this bar concept was on one for sure! This place is crazy looking! It's a 70's themed conversion van looking bar. Some of the tables were spruced up with actual car seats, car jacked table tops, 8 track players and yes even a freaking water bed! 

There were other things that caught my eye at the bar. There was a stripper pole for one, a shiney disco ball, a bong or two and 70's porn pics on the floor! No wonder the floor was all sticky! Yikes!

If you are looking for a bar that has a huge variety of beer then this bar is not it. All they have to offer is crappy cheap beer, but that just adds to the 70's theme!
author: Darryl P.

description:
Twas a dark and stormy Thursday. And everyone knows Thursdays are the new Fridays... so we were scamming for new places to go, and stumbled upon Kozy Kar. We booked it down to Polk... and were not stoked. 

Well at first it was great: porn on the floor, water beds, some good looking folks, 2 Dutch boys who I got to reminisce about my NL days with..and WATERBEDS!

So I guess those were the perks. Not really cheap drinks, not really nice bartenders, not fun music. 

Oh, and the owner? My friend met him. His words were something along the lines of "San Francisco is such a s***hole now. All these homeless people! I need to get out of here. This place sucks!"

Ok so I'm paraphrasing, and only overheard this happening, but when someone insults my city? Homie don't play that. 

I'd like to come back on a Friday or Saturday and hope that there would be some fun dancing tunes, no owner...and space on the waterbed :)

UPDATE! Just read all the other reviews. The douchiness came rushing back to me. And this owner? Ew. I thought it was a single experience, but I was way wrong. I wonder how all those other "17" bars of his are doing back in bumf***-nowhere, if they exist at all.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I was looking forward to checking the place out.  New bar, not too far from the TL, sounded decent enough.  But the crowd wasn't my scene.  It was full of frat boys and sorority chicks.  I felt like i was in the Marina....and wanted to bolt straight for the door.  Had my friend not told me to get into any fights, i would have punched the college girl wearing flip flops (flip flops in a bar?  eh to each their own I guess) who looked like she came straight off of Union Street right in her face when she thought it was "cute" to hop into our booth that we had been waiting over an hour for.  The vibe for the night was ruined.

Im being generous with 3 stars because its not Kozy's fault they're attracting rude frat boys with their equally rude ditzy girlfriends.  I'll give them this, i like the place and the decor, with the whole 70s theme, is unique and pretty cool.  How many bars in the city can you walk into and be greeted with a rape van complete with waterbed and playboy spreads lining the floor?  Even though the music wasnt all 70s, i was still diggin most of the plays.  Also, the staff is pretty friendly and drinks were decently priced.

I do have one question....towards the end of the night, they started a line outside of the door and were denying people entrance (my friends were with us but stepped out for a bite and couldnt get back in).  Are you a club or a bar?  

All in all, i probably wont be returning until the Marina stays in the Marina.
author: Juv C.

description:
Shockingly mediocre. 

Terrible beer, poor ergonomics and a lame crowd. The campyness was fun for a few minutes, but when that died, so did my fun. 

Later, losers.
author: Adam L.

description:
Things I learned at Kozy Kar:

Schlitz  is better than Oly is better than Hamm's 
70's Playboy models are better than current Playboy models 
Wednesday night is better than Saturday night 
Steve Miller Band is better than Dave Matthews Band 
CB Radios are better than iPhone 
8 Track is better than MP3

Seriously though, I can't add much to the reviews other than to say you really should check out Kozy Kar for yourself. It already has a solid weeknight following, I imagine it would be a shit show on the weekends. Get there early, check all preconceived "theme bar" ideas at the door and have fun.

You might even see me at the end of the bar trying to figure out who wins in the battle of Miller High Life vs. PBR.
author: phil h.

description:
I LOVE themed bars! This place is absolutely great because it has some crazy booths made out of old cars, 70s/80s porn on the walls, The Brady Bunch and Partridge Family on the tvs, and 70s/80s music...whats not to love? Some reviewers took offense with the porn on the walls/floor and the snippets of porn thrown into episodes of The Brady Bunch -- really? jeez, have a sense of humor! Way too uptight.

Anyways, it was pretty awesome sitting on a water bed watching some School House Rock with snippets of porn in it and sippin' a beer. I can only imagine what has gone down on that water bed -- tons of makeout sessions, I'm sure ;P I almost felt like I should be at a white trash party -- mullets, cheap beer (except its not really cheap, but reasonably priced), and stripper poles. 

Kozy Kar, I will be coming back!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This is so my 'hey gurls lets have a freakin awesome time tonight' bar - start, finish, or all night. Love the owner too. My only complaint is how cramped it is between bar and wall before you get to the back, where there is plenty of room - but how many bars in SF are like that?

Highlights:
-Waterbeds
-CB radios
-Soft core porn all over walls and dance floor highlight themes - more fun than kinky
-Kitchy videos on the booths
-Resaonable prices
-Friendly owner and staff
-Good for socializing and meeting new people
author: Mary F.

description:
We went on a Thursday night when it wasn't overly crowded. The car nooks provided a great place to hang out, and the vintage shows and commercials playing on the TV made for great conversation about the good ol' days. The porn interspersed was funny and not over the top.

The drinks were cheap, even though it wasn't happy hour, and the waterbed was a blast. 

Great bar... I don't know what people are complaining about!
author: Kristen B.

description:
So far, so good.  Message from Sam lifted off the website:  

"Please act like an adult and respect the bar as well as its patrons.
We will not tolerate the frat boy mentality.
Please go to the Marina instead."

God bless you.  A man after my own heart.
author: Irene S.

description:
I've heard of this good concept bar from a good friend of mine. So we thought should give it a shot. We went there one  night, I'd say it's really hard to find this place if don't look carefully.  

Music is ok.
Decor is good.
Drinks : Cocktails weren't good, stick to the beer will save you.
Casual place to hang out : Yes!
author: Sasitorn O.

description:
They carded me at the door on a weekday evening.  Inside dark, over-the-top redneck bumpkin decor, lots of white people who weren't born in the era the bar depicts but if you grew up in a little town where everyone listened to 38 Special and watched Starsky and Hutch your parents were probably drinking this kind of beer around the time you were conceived.  It reminded me of a tiki lounge except instead of Polynesia and fruity rum drinks it was all redneck middle America and cheap beer.  It all seems a little contrived because it isn't a dive bar and there never was a bar like this in the era, it pays homage to the 1970s like a pinball game, with lots of lights and noise and things that go bing, not by really recreating what life was like then.  But there's plenty to look at, period photos of naked girls laminated into the bartop.  

A thick crowd of 21-25 year olds seemed to be enjoying themselves.  Everything was clean and orderly, staff was as cordial and efficient as could be given the crush.

It all made me feel very old, and there wasn't any reason to be here except to say I'd been.  It's a tiny place, not conducive to strike up a conversation with anyone you didn't come with.  The alcohol is a backlash against fancy liquor and artisan cocktails.  It's kind of cool to drink your father's weak canned beer once in a while, Olympia is a great refresher on a hot day.
author: Gil S.

description:
Get it while it's hot...and the UV wands don't show anything you don''t want to touch. 

The place is awesomely ridiculous. Waterbeds, working CB radios, bong wall ornamentation and all the ridiculousness that the 70s had to offer. One of the booths in back is a replica of the no window, child molesters vans made popular by the 70s complete with waterbed and captain chairs. 

The downside is the fact that they don't have any wines and while I applaud their commitment to the theme, the beers are all crappy. This is CA and they need to throw a craft beer or two onto the list. 
Although, I have to say that that ordering a Schlitz while awkwardly avoiding the 70s porn photos laminated to the bar was an experience. By the time I had to use the restroom I didn't even flinch at the bush/boob covered floor. 

Again, get there before all of the props are broken/stolen/soiled.
author: R M.

description:
Fun place, just don't take it too seriously and don't order anything more classy than an Oly ("No beer on the bar is better than Oly! Pour an Oly and you're second... to none!). 

Also be forewarned that the video screens may show that scene from "Deliverance."  Yes, that scene.
author: Beau G.

description:
This place is not for me. 

Maybe if I was high, I would have appreciated the all the porn on the ground, the over-sized white bar chairs, and the waterbeds in the back.

My drink (vodka/gingerale) was totally gross. I took 2 sips.
author: Misha F.

description:
You know when the bar tender is shot gunning hamms with you... It's going to take A LOT for you to get kicked out...

Immediately attracted by the kozy kar seats at the bar, I stole a seat only to notice the lovely pinup posters all over the place. The shiny vinyl, the water beds, the car radios, seductive videos all over.... basically if pick 'n' pull threw up on boogie nights, you would have the birth of Kozy Kar! 

I guess it also has that "butter" feel but without the paper bags or the food. 

I wish it were my neighborhood bar.
author: Rada I.

description: Kozy Kar is definitely one of the craziest bars I've ever been to, but how can you argue with waterbeds, hippie vans, and 70's porn?  The first time I ordered drinks there, Sam (the owner) doubled my jack and coke free of charge and then offered me a shot of fernet.  He's a great guy, and I get along really well with the entire staff.  I would give it 5 stars if the bar was a little wider.  The bar fills up on the weekends, so I recommend stopping by late night or going on a weekday.
author: Bud L.

description:
Excellent execution of a fantastic theme.  Vanning?  Why hasn't this been done before?  Little touches like the jack stands holding up the liquor shelf and the chain steering wheel lamps are awesome.  Bartenders were nice and served us quickly.  Crowd interesting, good place to come with friends and lounge.  Best part?  My friend and I had come from a Yom Kippur break-the-fast and were still in suits, which the fellow Tribe-member bartender noticed.  Without hesitation, he pulled out three shot glasses and poured us shots of Manischewitz.  Hilarious.  I felt like the Hebrew Hammer.

Shalom, motherf*cker.
author: Eric M.

description:
Easily one of the greatest bars I've ever heard of, let alone been to.  This bar is an old 70's van barsonified, yeah you read it right barsonified(TM GreydonU).

  Working CB radios connecting every booth will bring back that deep seated desire to restore a TransAm and grow a Burt Reynolds 'stache.

  Drinking cans of Schlitz at tables propped up by jack stands will have you smokin' like Tony Stewart.

  The waterbeds will give you that half naughty, half sea-sick feeling.

  The stripper pole and 70's playboy centerfolds add that touch of class every joint like this should have.

  Bottom Line:  I love a bar that can make me feel like two of my top 5 idols AND make me feel ill all in one night...  So grab your favorite canned domestic brew, pull up a freshly  upholstered drivers seat, and hold on for the ride of your life!
author: Greydon U.

description: I love this bar.  I mean, they have WATERBEDS for seating!  Yes, real waterbeds.  They aren't firm either so every move {even the slightest roll of the eyeballs} makes you bounce around like you are riding a wave on a surfboard.  Such a fun atmosphere with good drinks.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I have watched the flick "The Van" multiple times. I used to (only half-jokingly) say that I wanted to get a van with a wizard *and* a wolf painted on the side. 

So, I dig a bar that has its very own van set-up you can chill out in. Kitschy? Yep!  But cozy? Yep, that too.
