Any bar with a dog usually gets extra points from me. I spent some time petting Tessa, the sweet pooch behind the bar, and felt like I was back closer to home at the Lager House, with friendly dogs hanging out. 

The atmosphere is a wee bit dingy, but that's why bars are dark, people! Plus, I think a bar like this needs a little grit to balance the kitsch, and that's what it's got. Plus, drinks seemed cheap for SF... and they have Lone Star. Sweet!
author: mariah c.

description:
This place gets mad points for uniqueness.  From the waterbed, to the vintage porn (moneyshots included), to the shellacked newspaper flooring, Kozy Kar has an ambience that I haven't seen anywhere else.

That said, the bar staff make high school dropouts look like overachievers, and the bar selection is about as compelling as a kazoo concert.  It's a good second bar when you have nowhere else to go, but definitely never a first choice, and should not take precedence if you have something else to do (like the aforementioned kazoo concert).
author: Dmytro A.

description:
Fun themed bar! Wasn't expecting the whole porn / centerfold situation on the floors and being spliced into the video. I thought it was funny but it probably would've been off-putting to more conservative people. 

Service is great but drinks are kind of expensive during peak hours. Anchor steam bottles for $6 is a little steep. 

All-in-all, a fun place to hang out on a Friday nights and watch your more conservative friends squirm when something graphic flashes on the TV. :)
author: Asheley W.

description:
Parking is a bit hard to find in this area....but once you do, this place is a good time!  

Thanks to Jon (the awesome bartender)....pause, he provided one helluva time for all of us.  The drinks were stiff....pause.  the service was exceptional.  

Furry walls, water beds, trailers for booths, and porn adorn this bar.  

Btw, if you're going to drop the deuce....do it before coming out.  They only have one stall, and i don't think it has a lock.  I saw some dude with his bare ass showing when someone opened the door him.  That dude, probably will give this place 1 star...
author: Daniel M.

description:
These stars are for having an awesome 70's swingers' van theme. Waterbed and bucket seats in the booths made of van shells, 1 full waterbed in the back of a van, 70's movies playing, CB'ing the other booths, stripper pole and, of course, every inch of floor covered with full-on nude *70's* chicks... with all the... naturalness that entails. Truly original and pretty well executed.  

But, the layout of this place is one of those classic SF travesties.  It's super narrow all the way from the door to the end of the bar, making it virtually impossible to get in and out let alone order a drink. This is only made harder by the giant white van seats that run along most of the bar. Although some think this awesome and I get that it goes with the theme but, uh, would it kill them to get *one* good beer in the place or at least anything on tap? Their liquor selection is equally (purposely) low-ride and just not what I'm really looking for in a bar.

That being said, because of the awesomeness detailed in Paragraph 1, I think this is a cool spot and would come back for an early evening starter beer when it's not so packed... or a private party.

*Update* The owner has informed me that they have added 21st Amendment IPA, Coors Light and Fat Tire to the beer collection. I don't personally drink any of these beers, but the IPA and the Fat Tire are objectively good so props for stepping it up, Kozy Kar! (3.5)
author: Kristina A.

description:
Two words: Water. Beds. 

If you would like to see me doing barefoot somersaults and contortionist antics while drunk, this is the place to be. If you're just tired of the same old-same old on Polk, this is the place to be. Refreshing, fun, and stocked with great drinks as well as water beds and cozy nooks and crannies, this is the new place to see and be seen (flipping and flopping or just drinking at the bar). You can not resist the water bed or 70s/80s music. DO NOT fight it. Just remember to wear panties and take your shoes off before diving head-first into the waterbeds.

**Did I mention there's something I thought was a stripper pole on top of the bar? Regardless of it's intended purpose, I did some things to that pole that I should have been paid for. Next time, Kozy Kar. You can get me back next time...
author: Autumn K.

description: This is now my favorite bar in SF. We were there for a bachelorette party over the weekend and it was very impressive. I also looked on their website and LOVE LOVE LOVE the fact that they have a review section with their bad reviews from some DBagger that is so obviously jealous that they have hit their mark.  I will be back as much as I can and tell everyone i know how cool it is. Love the pics in the bathroom, who cares what kind of beer or drinks they have. ...There is a water bed and a 70's van
author: Emily M.

description: I have never seen so much porn and drunk people in the same place.  Oh, and there's a waterbed.  Come here if you're unsure as to whether or not you hate yourself.
author: Michael D.

description: I really like the jacuzzi booth we sat it as we sipped on drinks.  We were sitting in a jacuzzi! Even when I am sober, it still blows my mind! I could do without the naked women on the floor or the porno scenes that kept flashing on TV, but hey, I was chillin in a hot tub
author: Dominique Y.

description:
My friends and I love Kozy Kar! We do, however, only end the night there, as it is way too weird to be sober in...
The motif is unlike any other. Shag waterbeds, porn covered floors, car seat booths and 80's music make for one weird theme bar. On weekends it is crowded and hot but the bartenders are quick and friendly. Its a great place to be at the end of a wild night!
author: Kenzie P.

description:
My review will probably change and get better after this place has been open for a few months, but for now I would give it a solid 3.5.

The good stuff...

**3 dollar PBR's and efficient bartenders
**a water bed in the back
**70's centerfold and porn lining the floor and bathrooms
**a sexy young crowd
**sex, drugs, rock and roll!!

The bad stuff

**beer may be cheap but booze is pricey. $7 for a Fernet shot? No way
**Music can be really bad sometimes, the 70's are over for sure
**it's new so it's crowded...like REALLY crowded.

Keep reading for an update after the holidays...
author: Lynsey C.

description:
This place is definitely one of a kind. They really spared no expense with the attention to detail in her as far as the decor goes. 

My only complaint is that they don't allow you to reserve the booths but if I owned the place and it was this busy I wouldn't either. 

The drinks were also a little more pricey than I expected as well. 

either way it's damn good times and if you get a booth with a group of people you will be loving it. 

I wish more people were dancing in here..... or actually .. I did notice the sound is kind of shitty .... so maybe that's the problem.... 

But complaints aside.. I still give it 4 stars just for being unique and something different. 

Step up the sound and lower the drink prices and 5 stars for sure!
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Came here for my birthday this last Saturday and was blown away.
This is my new fave dive bar. It's more than a dive bar though.
We scored the van in the back that had access to the water bed.
Great music, great crowd.
Don't expect much variety as far as liquor/beer goes, only canned beer and basic vodka. No flavors of any kind. The prices are cheap, bartenders are friendly.
I love their website where it states "We will not tolerate the frat boy mentality. Please go to the Marina instead". Yes you heard them go back to the Marina where you belong douche bags!
Love this place!!!!
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
I met my Snooki twin on Halloween here and had a fist pumping good time on Halloween....drinks aren't over priced...I ilke that.  


and who doesn't like 70's porn?
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
This bar is amazing. The website tells you what they serve, so check in advance, you might get your feelings hurt that they don't carry your favorite premium Ale. 

The staff is professional and cool, I had no problems at all....

Read the one star reviews on here, then check out this place for yourself, I'm sure you be able to decifer how great this place is.
author: Taj A.

description:
What a naughty little bar. Seriously. 

My boyfriend's brother's roommate recommended this place for us to go with my boyfriend's cousin and his fiancee. We walked over, since it was fairly close. And we were already prepared to expect a guy's guy bar. 

You walk into this very narrow bar and it looks fairly normal. Then you walk towards the back and you're taken into a glorified junkyard of conversion vans and subtle tribute to porn. Vintage Playboy centerfolds graced the floor of the back part of the bar. Clips of vintage 70s tv shows and movies are shown on all the tiny tv monitors and if you stare long enought, you will see a 01.5 seconds of vintage porn. Its exciting. Its interesting. It will take your mind off losing to Simon Says or your lack of attempt to get off the questionable waterbed that is in one of the corners. 

After a Jager-bomb and PBR, I did find comfort in the leather van seat in one of the booth areas. Why in the hell did we have to leave?!? Until next time.....
author: Jamie L.

description:
KK is sweet.  It's NOT a 70's theme bar.  It's a 70's custom van theme bar.  BIG DIFF. If your swinger parents, big brother, or gross uncle had such a van, you get it and you love it.  

You pretty much know you're going to like or hate it before you enter the place.  If you're uptight and hate yourself, then it's probably not the best place for you.
author: Chris W.

description:
This place is really tough to rate...
On the one hand, the theme is great; 70's interior design, Van/waterbed in the back, cool bartenders, unique overall concept...The owners put some thought into it, and it definitely works...very unique.

A couple negatives: 1) The lack of beer selection. I understand it's supposed to be a simple place without the expensive, intricate beers, etc etc etc...I completely understand that, but with that said, just give us a few more options; I don't remember if there were any beers on tap, but if there weren't, maybe put a few up there....
2) Way too crowded all four times I've been there...I think I need to try this out on a weekday for a drink or two...I might it enjoy it a bit more.


When all said and done, I recommend everyone check this place out and decide for themselves...I don't love it or hate it, and I'll definitely continue to come back (considering it's two blocks from my place), but I have a hard time giving it 4 stars based on how crammed it has been every single time I've gone.....Who knows, a few more visits and I could bump this up a star...
author: Farbod D.

description:
Average gimmick bar in SF.

My buddy heard about this place and we decided to check it out. We came on a Friday night around 9-10 and it was pretty slow. The decor was delightfully cheesy with a 70s feel that had a water bed couch that was novel at first but a little hard to get comfortable. 

I liked that they had cheep beer from a can. My favorite was Schlitz.("Whatevers free") The bartenders were slow with the refills and seemed to ignore me and my friends. A little annoying since the bar was pretty quiet.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I'm afraid to even post this.  The word is going to get out on this place and when it does, it is going to be an absolute Gong Show.

1970s TV references aside, this might be the coolest bar I've ever set foot in.  Waterbeds, custom vans, orange shag carpet, sparkly vinyl and tasteful pictures of nekkid girls lacquered into the bar...can you really ask for anything else?

Because if you did, you might ask for a solid bartender with no attitude and old-school Van Halen on the stereo.  And this place has both.
author: Jon S.

description: Whats with people in SF taking coats all the time? And worst part, replacing it with ugly leopard fur ones. Stealing can be a big problem, but it can also be solved with some help and understanding people. Sketchy, ugly decor, porn photos on the floor, douchey hit ons, bathrooms with no doors, NEXT..
author: Stephanie M.

description: I stopped in for a drink before a show at Red Devil. The bartender on duty was nice, and the shag van area gave me flashbacks to my uncle Arturo's van with shag carpeting, but there weren't pictures of naked women everywhere (my aunt wouldn't allow it) just rosary beads hanging from the windshield mirror, and 7 screaming kids playing in the back (me included). My sister in law who is from Spain was with me and she was definitely amused although a little embarrassed. Well, at least I gave her something to talk about when she goes back. Check it out when it's not busy and take some friends with a good sense of humor. All and all it's a good place to grab a quick drink.
author: Sheila T.

description:
This is one of those places that I just always have a great time. 

The decor is radical: 1970's sparkly vinyl, old van parts, shag carpeted waterbeds, and playboy centerfolds covering every other surface. Love it.

Also, they carry Oly in the can.
author: Peter C.

description:
Where the crap did this place come out of?

This is my local go-to intersection for a drink- either veer right for McTeagues, or swerve left for Bigfoot... all of a sudden after veering left...wait- is that a water bed?? Crazy! 

I lovelove this end of Polk St for its crazy-ass bars that apparently just keep getting better!
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
I love fine dining but boy after work I really want a PBR! Its a fun place to go with friends but to be honest this is not a place for a first date. The chick will think you are weird or a pervert. No i have never been groped and it's not because I am fat or old. (no offense). Give it a chance and make your own decision, feel uncomfortable? leave. There are so many places out in Russian Hill! To each his/her own. 
P.S
Sam is awesome for giving yelpers a dose of their own medicine. 
Love the bar. I am sick of this whole Elite thing: Elite to what?  you don't get free food or drinks because you are "Elite" and no you are not like the Michelin Guide or Michael Bauer,
author: Elsa C.

description:
Water. Bed. Padded. Walls. GMC. Van. Great. Waitresses. CBs.  

If the Mystery Machine was a bar, it would be here. 

Don't expect good beer, good vodka, good bourbon. No draft beer...just good ol' cans.

Just come with a good attitude.
author: Todd S.

description:
So much controversy with Kozy Kar! 

After the Yelp Mixtape event, my girlfriends and I came up with the brilliant drunken idea of checking out Kozy Kar since it wasn't a weekend night.  We decided to head on over (in style of course, getting picked up by a cop in a huge a SUV after waiting on a cab that never showed - yeah, that's how we roll).

For starters, I actually enjoyed the doorman and am pretty sure he's not a fratastic gay-hater.  We had a nice coversation and he seemed to be pretty friendly and outgoing while checking IDs.  

The bar is filled with your average lower Nob Hill frequenters and the beer selection is pretty shitty.  The PBR's should've costed a $1, not $3, especially since they're served in a klassy kan. 

I enjoyed the music, the dance floor, the 70s decor, and the naked lady flooring (playboy centerfolds) throughout the dance area and bathroom.  The seating is pretty sweet; we found a carseat that fit four of us perfectly.  Apparently, the have a couple waterbeds too, which could be romantical for a date, although I would be horrified if someone ever recommended this place for a date...

I could definitely see myself coming back here, but never on a weekend night. It's not that cool and it probably sucks when it's crowded.
author: Jenny W.

description:
I was so disappointed by my experience here. But let me get one thing straight, it is not because the place is not awesome. It is in fact totally awesome. I would like to move in here or hire their decorator to redo my house like this. Loved the tunes, LOVED the decor, loved the drink selection, loved everything about this place except one thing: the crowd! 

I guess this is proof that this is a happening bar because it was PACKED! I mean there was a long moment when my 3 friends and I were pushed up against the narrow hallway wall and literally could not move at all. This did not make for pleasant drinking and conversing. 

Would I come back? Abso-freakin-lutly, this bar looks awesome. BUT, I would come way earlier than 11pm on a Saturday and score one of the cool vans for seating, or I would come on a weeknight when the bar is a little more empty and I could maybe snag a water bed. Dammit Kozy Kar, this was not our destiny, but we will meet again. 

I'll be back Kozy Kar, and this time I am coming back with a plan.
author: Jessica M.

description: Porn playing on tv- pretty awesome, girls tend to not like this place but I do. Its a cool concept and they serve cheap drinks. Its a bar on Polk can't expect anything less.
author: Jess O.

description:
Like butter, but not so focused on trailer trash.

Kozy Kar is stuck  in a time warp, a Boogie Nights time warp.  We all wished we had a 70's van with a disco ball and bed in the back to woo those ladies.  Now you don't have to buy that van, just head to Polk St.  They have waterbeds here, crappy beer like Schiltz and Olympia at $3 a pop, booths with car seats, a pole for the ladies, playboys on the bar and dance floor for the guys, an actual van front end, and classic rock and roll.

Don't know what kind of crowds will show for this place, but definitely a fun theme.

People on Polk will see an influx of people wearing 70's clothing for their 70's themed parties.  Groovy!
author: Po L.

description: love the theme, and the drinks! i don't quite recall what drinks i had since i only told the bartender that i like sweet drinks better and she made all those delicious drinks within mins! i'll def go back!
author: Ru C.

description: $2 PBR's, Jacuzzi or van seats, cool videos playing from pg-X rated....
author: John R.

description: I've been living in the city and going to bars for years now, so how did I miss this place? The lady read plenty of reviews about this place and the moment I heard her description of this place, we had to see what this place was all about. When you first that this place mashes up hardcore pornography and 80's movies and music videos in one crazy montage, you have to think twice about what you just heard because really? A bar that mashes up hardcore pornography with 80's movies and music videos? The music in here matches the era too, so it's a definitely enjoyable. With two waterbeds in the bar and cheap drinks, what's not to love about this place? The only thing that sets me off is that you feel you need a shower after you sit on anything.
author: Michael N.

description:
Although some of the recent reviews have provided me with great entertainment let me just state this - i don't know anyone who works here, i also don't know that Megan d chic, and finally i am no where close to elite.

I am simply going to review this place on the experience i had a few weeks ago.

I randomly ended up there on a wednesday with a friend because we were in the area and felt like checking it out. The crowd was good: a decent mix of people, everyone was having a good time, and it wasn't packed.

What might be surprising to some (even me at the time) was how nice the bartender was. I think in the short span i was there he actually went out of his way to ask if people were having a good time and enjoying themselves. I can't really say i have ever seen a bartender do that - especially on a fairly busy night.

All in all, i ended up having one of the best times drinking on a wednesday that i've had in awhile - and it was largely based on the customer service.

That said, i do have a little common sense and understand that the scene would probably be different on the weekends and have decided to give it a month or two before i head back. Like any new place in the city, it is going to be jammed when it opens and will draw all types of crowds. Sadly, it seems like a lot of the people engulfed in the lame drama surrounding this place still haven't learned that.
author: charlie A.

description: 1st time going tonight. annnd it was AMAZING! Everyone who works here was funny and nice. The inside theme was unbeatable. I will diffidently go again even though its a bit far from my pad.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description:
What really turned me onto this place was the pictures of the super fly blond and the swank "van" atmosphere. To be honest I was a little dissapointed when I came in on Tuesday night. Hopefully this place gets crackin' on the weekends. 

The folks who work here are pretty chill, but disappointingly make weak drinks. Need to work on your pours gentlemen. Also, one of my friends got a can of Fat Tire to drink and it ran her $6! Holly smokes!
author: Chris B.

description: A relief for one's arse.  Some people like to dance, but I'm mainly a fan of the themed booths and comfy seating.  It's a great place to hang out during weekdays and earlier in the evening, but the intrigue somewhat loses its charm for me once it starts getting packed and I have to resort to shouting.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Unique and hilarious bar decor with a sleazy red-velvety water bed near the entrance. Fair drink prices, interesting clientele, and a great place to relax midweek. 

Since it's one of those bars set up like a hallway, it'll tend to get overcrowded on weekends, but definitely worth a trip to check it out.
author: Joe A.

description: This place is a retro amusement park from a shag water bed sitting area to a booth made of a hot tub shell.  Model pin ups all over ceiling and floor, I would take both my local and out of town friends here if they haven't been before and it works for me as a watering hold with drink prices that are more than reasonable.
author: Jo A.

description:
As the years go by, the elderly shake their heads in disapproval and the youth continue to become more and more desensitized to everything. Kozy Kar is doing its part by overexposing kids to porno which is pretty much all over the back half of this bar. If the Playboys floor tiles and the movie Debbie Does Dallas playing on the flat screens doesn't scare you away, Kozy Kar is a pretty all around fun place to have a drink and be at a happening place on Polk St.

The bar definitely gets packed, to the point where they probably should have started a line 30 minutes ago but didn't. Plus the lay out of the bar itself is terrible, there's hardly any space between the counter and the wall for people to stand without getting elbowed and nudged by passer-byers every 15 seconds. But some people are into that, this place definitely has a lot of commotion going on which can add to the excitement of drinking on a weekday.

My biggest beef with this place is that they don't have a tap. The only time I drink out of a can is if I'm at a house party, I go to the bar to get a fresh pint of beer. On top of that, the beer they do have is about as cheap as it gets. Fortunately I'm not a very picky beer drinker, but if you're not down with PBR, then definitely go with the hard alcohol.

The music they play is upbeat and not too loud, so you can dance, chat, or just binge drink at your own pace. They generally play some fun dance hits and even the classic 80s songs that everyone knows and loves, whether you want to admit that or not is up to you.

Bottom line: Kozy Kar is great for a bar crawl party but not the coolest spot on the block. If you're looking to grab a seat and get comfortable with your friends, I wouldn't suggest this place.
author: Anthony C.

description: Very unique bar.  When you walk into this place, you think, ok, this is going to be your typical SF bar, very narrow and long, and  filled to the brim with dudes.  However, this was very different, yes it's long and semi narrow, BUT, its a very mixed crowd with decent ratios, some people are dressed up and others are in there chill attire, there's a small dance floor, then the booths mimic car's with furry pink/yellow interior.  The music is mixed and not insanely loud, so you can actually have a semi decent conversation without using megaphones.  Another major cool thing about the place, of course besides the rad videos throughout the bar, is the location, if its an off night (which unfortunately happens to any favorite spot), there are a several other hot spots nearby.  So, to summarize go here immediately..
author: Mike M.

description:
*Cool 70s decor
* bleh beer (surprised no Budlight with the crappy beer choice)
* No draft beer
* Nice bartenders
*Nerds playing video games (haha that was me- drinking a beer with a straw).
author: Em A.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars on Polk Street. It's so random and fun!

Randomness:
- BIG white bar chairs
- Waterbeds
- Old porn photos on the floor (in the back)
- Pleather walls
- Fur-lined booths
- Music videos (with short porn clips intermittently throughout)

The music is super fun and the atmosphere is wild. Definitely a favorite.
author: Lauren F.

description: The only reason this got a full 3 stars is that the decor needs to be seen and enjoyed at least once.  A booth that is the interior of a creepier 70s van complete with water bed, another booth that used to be a hot tub, and a couple others.  But my friends and I had an entire discussion about the fact that the bartender never smiled nor did he look at any of us in the eyes.  Also, the drinks were just OK.
author: Tia B.

description:
The minute we walked in, we saw some chick giving this guy one hell of a blow job on the TV.   So, after grabbing an Olympia from the bar we proceeded to find some groovy chairs to sit on, anxiously awaiting the next porn scene on the TV.


I really don't know what else there is to say.  You either get it or you don't.  You dig?
author: Chris B.

description:
The decor at this place is fun if you can see it through the crowd.  We went on a Friday night and it was absolutely packed... like wait-in-line-to-get-in kind of packed.  (I hadn't done that in a LONG time, but we were meeting friends inside).

The bartenders were friendly and made stiff drinks, which was greatly appreciated.  The clientele was on the young side and pretty sloppy, but maybe it was just an off night.  I must say, the ladies' restroom was disgusting!  Again cool decor, but get someone in there with a mop!
author: Jamie B.

description:
Kozy Kar is the bar I didnt know I had been waiting for my whole life. In fact, I'm hesitant to even review it. It feels like trying to write a compelling personal ad for the woman you've fallen madly in love with and has just agreed to marry you. It feels impossible to do it justice, and thus like a betrayal. 

Dearest Kozy Kar,

You have shag carpet lined water beds inside of you Your bartenders attend to me so quickly that I am often caught off -guard, still uncertain of my drink order, even on a Saturday night when you're damn near capacity. When I step inside of you, my darling, even before I approach the bar, I am instantly several hedons happier. Your booths, so dimly lit, call to me with their sirens song; your water beds, oh, those waterbeds! Your waterbeds appeal like no other, infusing any evening with magic--as if anything were possible.

I love you, Kozy Kar. There's no other bar for me.

Always and truly yours,

Devin
author: Devin F.

description:
If you like themed-bars, this is one to check out! I highly recommend getting there early to secure a spot in one of the cozy vans, if not the water bed located at the front of the bar. You won't have to wait long to be served because they've got plenty of staff behind the bar, which is always a plus. The only annoying thing about the bar were the stools! They are in the shape of car seats, which make it a bit difficult to squeeze through to place your order at the bar - not the most efficient or practical use of space. 

BTW - if you are not comfortable with nudity, you may want to avoid the centerfolds plastered on the floors and counter :) 

No wonder there was a whole lot of sexual tension around the bar...not sure I'd use the toilet in this bar.

All-in-all, fun place to experience, but nothing special about their cocktails - just a place to grab a couple of beers or a vodka tonic.
author: Kim H.

description: Not living in the SF area and my friend telling me about a waterbed themed bar with old van seats, I just had to scope this joint out. This place is AWESOME! From topless photos of Claudia Schiffer to "If this van's a rockin', don't cumma knockin'" style booths, I give this place 4 stars for it's originality. It's all so tacky (in a cool way) and they even have PBR to boot. Stay classy, San Francisco. :)
author: Celia C.

description:
We decided to take our out-of-towner friends to Kozy Kar last weekend after all the rave reviews we've heard about this new bar. To be honest, I wasn't sure what to expect of a place that has waterbeds, stripper poles and Playboy centerfolds as their floor covering, but I must admit... I LOVED IT!! 

We got there around midnight on Friday and the place was about 80% full. We grabbed drinks and were able to score a booth/van after 5 minutes. The working radios inside the booths were a nice touch, although it was a bit loud inside the bar so I wasn't able to hear much. Anyway - the atmosphere of the bar was great - good music, strong drinks, friendly bartenders and a nice/chill vibe. I'm a fan and will be back soon!
author: Alice W.

description:
I came here to say one thing. Kozy Kar has the best bartenders in the city. This place is packed shoulder to shoulder Friday and Saturday and I have somehow never waited more than 2 minutes for a drink. 
And did I mention the free shots of Manischewitz?! Mozzletoff fellas..
author: Moose F.

description:
I went here one night with a friend and was blown away.  They have every ironically 1974 cooltastic accessory you would find in your hooray I am so getting laid van while not being able to find your second bong load while lounging in the glitter back seat with fur on the side of it because you placed the crumbs and bud on the magazine centerfold in your lap and the planet sized bush of the woman on it sneakily HID the bud in plain view.  No matter, you can CB your friend at the next booth over under the yellow orange red sunset with palm tree scene and see if they have some box wine to make up for it.  And, dude... your friend's dog that will find that bud later on your leopard print floor is going to do some weirrrrrdd dog tricks later.  They'll be great to polariod!  

The staff there is fabulous.  You must pay them a visit.  Stellar decor.  Stellar theme.  I forgot to mention the "waterbed" seats.  Not so good for a bad back, but fun to sit on.  Refrain from the temptation to give the playboy spreads everywhere mustaches, regardless of how cool it feels.  The staff hates that.
author: Gwen P.

description:
Good place, good theme and nicely spliced harcore porn into the videos.

No really. Women dont seem to care, men cant not stare.

Good vibe in there, cheap PBR and a little dance floor/bed to party on.
author: Michael D.

description: If you don't understand why the Kozy Kar is so awesome, then just move out of SF, cause you don't belong.
author: Emily R.

description: No beer on tap. $7 for a 12 oz. bottle. Trashy old school porn is their gimmick.
author: Alpo H.

description:
I really don't appreciate crude racial epithets when I walk out of a bar.

But I got them from the bar-tender and his buddies when I walked out the other night.  

As an Asian man -- I do not recommend any of my brothers & sisters spend their money at this place.  

Nuff said.
author: Stan C.

description:
We ended up here after abandoning Smuggler's Cove...a 1.5 hour wait at 7.30pm is no bueno! Kozy Kar wasn't too crowded, and we were able to kind of take over part of the back area.

The kitschy decorations cracked us all up...I don't think a picture was taken without some sort of boobies appearing (not our own, thankyouverymuch). The drinks were stiff and not too expensive.

We left before the crowd got too much to handle, but I could definitely see it happening here, what with the boobs, back seats of cars, and waterbed.
author: Annie F.

description:
An amazing place to kick back and enjoy a few drinks with current and new friends. The bartenders are all super friendly, Brian and Matty are my favorites!

Get there early to grab a prime spot on one of the water bed lounges or booths in the back. 

It can get kind of crowded on weekends, if that's the kind of thing that deters you be sure to stop in on a Tuesday or Wednesday night.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Pros: 
No cover (I went on a Saturday night)
Unique interior decor
Pretty, friendly crowd
Plenty of attentive bartenders, good drinks served quickly all night
Short bathroom line all night
There's a little area to dance in the back

Cons:
The area to dance is very small
Wasn't wild about the music playing (I wanted to hear some hip hop), didn't see a jukebox. Not unbearable by any means. 
Drinks were a little pricey, but not unreasonable.

All in all I would recommend it, fun and different!
author: Ian K.

description:
In a NUTshell, this place was neither really GOOD nor really BAD.

However, I must admit, the 70s bar theme is unique!  There was a waterbed in the front, a  GMC van in the back, and NSFW photos on the bartops and walls, a la Casanova Lounge.

Bartenders seemed pretty cool. 

Drinks were pretty damn weak, so I'd probably just stick to the beer.
author: James C.

description:
It's really good, but it would be really great if it were in a less douchey neighborhood and broke with the theme long enough to have a few beers on tap.

Love that it has a classic Missile Command machine.
author: Andrew L.

description:
great place. bartender was a polite stallion that remembered my friend from his visit weeks ago.   

really creative seating and decor. very entertaining walls. floors and "shows" on tv 

drinks are reasonably priced and poured. 

bouncer was friendly. 

On a long weekend we were here twice and had a great time on both occasions. 

I recommend this bar. I will go back.
author: Thomas M.

description:
My friends think my first review of Kozy Kar was a little bit harsh, so allow me to elaborate.  First visit was great.  Tuesday night, good friend, excellent beret-wearing bartender (I think he also works at Bigfoot), and a really great drink.  Next visit was lame.  Friday night, a big group of my friends there for a birthday party with cake, gifts, the works.  When I ask the "owner" to turn off the music (which, mind you, is coming from a computer next to the register) so we can sing happy birthday, he flat out refuses.  Quote "I'm the owner and I don't turn off the music on a Friday." Really?  Because singing happy birthday isn't music?  The birthday girl, who is pretty fun, left without my prompting because, as she later told me, the music was terrible!  
Anyway, if you own a place, you should be thanking customers for supporting your dream, not shutting off at the first interesting suggestion of the night.  It's not like a asked him if I could DJ.  I just wanted his help in celebrating what could have been a great night for a lot of people.  Instead it was mediocre for most, and terrible for me.  I don't think any of us will go back to that bar.  
If you find yourself in the neighborhood, I wouldn't say avoid this bar like the plague, but I just think it fair to warn people that it's not the friendliest of places.  My friends hardly knew I was upset about anything, and yet most of them have said they didn't like the bar.  It's about vibes, people, and if you give paying customers a good vibe they'll come back. If you eek them out with rude attitudes AND a bunch of porno, they'll probably just tell all their friends how gross you are.
(As previously stated, the bar is surprisingly clean, and painstakingly decorated, so I still have to rate it a 2 star experience).
author: Trixie R.

description:
Came here on a weeknight and it wasn't too busy. LOVE the theme -- lots of vinyl, fuzzy trim and nudie photos from the pre-Brazilian era.

Grab a booth in the back and watch some cheesy 70's movie while using the radio to call other booths! My friends and I had never seen Repo Man, but it changed our lives.

Minus one star for not having very strong drinks. Overall good hangout spot though.
author: Tamara M.

description:
Excellent place to have a random time... in a good way

Was able to get in a van/waterbed with a group of friendly strangers... you can use the CB radios to talk to other cars!!! Can't really hear each other over the music / bar noise but still cool! Overall decor is 10, though the photos of naked woman on the floor is slightly disturbing because they all have GIANT bushes! Oh 70s!

Crowd was a mix of older crowd in sweaters on awkward frisk each other dates, casual every day crowd, hipster crowd, punk crowd, stuck in the 70s crowd, and people pretending to be stuck in the 70s.

I'm glad I went there while it was still pretty new. Would go back again, but wouldn't be as enthusiastic as trying to get on a water bed... I'm sure someone has taken advantage of the "shaggin wagon" by now... and if they haven't, they should!

I think my sister ended up pole dancing on a pole that was not prepared to become a pole dancing pole... we are not letting her go out in a wig again ;-)
author: Kelley C.

description:
Oh Kozy Kar, how I didn't want to like you.  See, I'm a simple man.  Give me a well poured bourbon or G&T, some good tunes or sports on the tube, and I'm set.  I read the reviews of this place and was quite hesitant. Airplane chairs?  Fur-lined booths?  Sounded a little too kitschy for me.
But you know what?  They know their schtick, they stick to it, and they make it work.  If you don't have fun at this place, then you're a) probably too young to be in their target market and b) maybe not human.
Yes, the place gets packed with an assortment of singles bar types.  However, I found them all very friendly and didn't experience a whit of aggro posturing as I normally would at a place like this.
Then, the 70's era stuff is pretty kick ass.  Yes, I (grandpa) could dig out my lps and 8-tracks and recreate a similar scenario, but I'm willing to pay for the convenience of them doing it for me.
Also, the bartenders pour heavy.  This is never, ever, a bad thing.  And the drinks are reasonably priced.
Finally, I had a random good karma moment (past experiences are not an indicator of future results, your mileage may vary), where I was waiting to order a round at the bar, and some guy just randomly paid for my drinks.
That's the kind of place KK is.  You'll find yourself high-fiving random strangers, singing along to the worst songs K-Tel has to offer, and loving every minute of it.
Docked one star because it does get too packed.
author: Ken V.

description:
Door guy was cool, decor was interesting (easy to wipe..), and service seemed ok, but spending an a$$ ton on a can of coors light makes me sad.

Worth checking out still if you are looking for somewhere new!
author: simon r.

description: Great addition to Polk street.  Can't believe it took me so long to go.  Very unique decor and good rock music.  The bathroom cracked me up because the flooring are pages from naughty magazines from the 70's.  The bartender wasn't the friendliest of bartenders but I didn't let that bug me.  I'll see how he is when I go back.  Maybe it was a bad night for him
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Umm... I really DID feel like I was transported back into the 70's. 

It's Thursday night at 10:45pm. There are 70's playboy models with their breasts out covered all over the bar. We go to the back, sit in furry van booths with screens slide showing vans. 

To my right was a young Ron Jeremy lookalike with a gigantic moustache and sunglasses on. Across from us in our "van" is a drunk swinger in a 70's psychadelic dress (umm... we kicked them out with our looks of horror). Our van was shooting some kind of smoke- maybe it was dry ice? And I swear I smelled some reefer. 

Wait- is all this a good thing? NO (and either were the curtains for doors on the ladies bathroom stalls). 

However, I give it 4 stars because: 

1) Friendly bartender
2) Not too crowded, laid back
3) Reasonable priced drinks
4) "Kozy" seating ;)
author: Noel H.

description: A bizarre, retro, lurid sensory overload.
author: Danny C.

description: Bouncer was a complete and total dick.  Drinks were ok, but bar staff were inattentive and the place was stifling hot.  You can see into the women's bathrooms which only have a crap curtain (instead of a door).  Interesting décor, but overall not a place I'd go to again given a choice.
author: Ali B.

description: Don't bother going here.  They must keep it dark because it is extremely dirty.  The bouncer is a jerk and it is hard to get the bartenders to get you a drink because they have bad attitudes too.  Not worth dealing with them for a dump of a bar.
author: Julieana A.

description:
I bought into the hype. 

Knowing that Kozy Kar had the potential to be incredibly douchy, I decided to test it out on a weeknight, to avoid a mass throng of trendsters. 

We got there super early, around 7:30 (the bar opens at 7) so we basically had our pick of seats. But what to choose? There are upholstered seats, booths comprised of van benches, a waterbed...

Obviously, we picked the waterbed. 

It was fun. We drank cheap beer and chilled, and, while once the crowd picked up plenty of people sort of peeped in to exclaim over the waterbed, nobody bothered us. 

What DID skeve us out was the fact that there's no cover on the waterbed - it's just a bare mattress. Gross. What if someone spills? Or does other waterbed-related things that make a mess? I kind of don't want to know. 

Kozy Kar is extremely gimmicky, but it seems like it will hold up. The service was good, the drinks were cheap. Although, since I'm a dour old lady and went at 7:30 on a weeknight,  I probably didn't have an authentic Kozy Kar experience.
author: Sara A.

description: Great people working here. Love the old school decor and the non stop entertainment. Great bar on friday and saturday nights.
author: T S.

description:
Usually I shy away when my friends head to Polk st., for good reason.  Perhaps for want of entertainment, I decided to go to Polk tonight and meet my friends at Kozy Kar.  I walked in and thought that it is an interesting crowd.  And, the Breakfast Club is being shown on the many TVs in the bar; not bad.  But wait... the scene on the TVs change, and its hardcore porn.  And there's tons of old dudes and young women.
Seems like I've entered the San Fernando Valley, and there's tons of old porn producers and the toxic sludge that drips down from the marina chatting up 21 year old women.  Beers are shockingly expensive for a dive bar, and you feel skeezy just leaning against the walls.
I probably would not head back, and would only recommend it if you are seeking an especially weird night.  We left and headed south, not much better.
author: Richard F.

description:
In celebration of my recent acceptance to the University of Wisconsin at Madison (Go Badgers! Why did you let Cornell eat you alive today?!?!?!), I wanted to go to a bar that was guaranteed to have crappy Milwaukee-based canned beer...that wasn't Zeitgiest. I also had my best friend/college buddy/fellow captain of the Cal Poly Chemistry Department Drinking Team in town for the American Chemical Society conference. I had a feeling we would both really dig this place.

And I got whiskey instead because I am predictable and I will just consume more beer when I visit Wisconsin (and Dr. Shelly V.!) next month....

So, as I expected, I did have to wait outside for a while to get in. Because I didn't get there until 11, I should not have been surprised. The bouncer had us wait a while before letting us in, despite the exit of several couples, because his manager has told him that the bar was too full inside. We couldn't really see inside and had no clue what their definition of "too full" was.

Um, I will admit that I am a month shy of 30 and have accepted that I am starting to feel old because I have lost a considerable amount of patience for certain nightlife behavoir and environments. My crowning moment of my advanced age is being in situations that leave me thinking, "Damn, if we have a fire in here, we will probably all die. I don't have enough faith in anyone here to actually be able to exit this establishment safely." Or thinking, "Have I always been this claustrophobic?" See where I'm getting? I had that feeling last night at Kozy Kar. Do they have a recommended occupancy that they just totally don't follow at all? Fuck! If I wanted to be in a situation where I was rubbing up against strangers, having beer poured down my shirt (but not in a wet t-shirt contest way), and not being able to actually get anywhere, I would still be in the general admission audience of heavy metal concerts. At least a good band would be involved. That scene is only cool if you're just inches away from touching Tool or Rage. But I digress. This bar was way too uncomfortably crowded. To be fair, a weeknight may be the best bet.

That said, I like the theme that they're going for. I actually used to have a waterbed when I was a bit younger...and I ain't going to elaborate much further on that. But I will say that I do often defend waterbeds when people question the "liquid-filled furniture" question of lease applications. Seriously. The only reason I want to own a house is so that I can have a waterbed again. A wall-to-wall one. A waterbed room. How cool is that.

Another thing. I know that I shouldn't have very high standards for bathrooms in bars. I get it. I know. But seriously, what's up with the Polk St. bars having SHOWER CURTAINS for their "doors?" At that, curtains that don't have little hook and eye closures for privacy...or at least curtains that are short enough so that you can see feet under them. You really do have to open the curtains or talk into them in order to see if someone is in the stall. It's not like you can knock! Gah! Peeve. 

I also got hit on by more swingers? And some random blonde tried to put her crotch in my face? That's not the bar's fault though....

But, in all fairness, by about 1 am, it thinned out and was pretty fun. Mr friend really digged it. I recommend it for weeknights. Hopefully they'll actually have Schlitz when I visit again. They were out. And I was not going to drink PBR. It's not ironic anymore, hipsters. (Not that I saw hipsters at Kozy Kar).
author: Zulu Q.

description: I met my friend's mom at this bar.  There were money shots on the television behind her as I shook her hand.  AWKWARD.  You can't really go wrong with a concept bar that has 70s and 80s porn stars shellacked into the bar and dance floor.  There is no shortage for conversation pieces, any small talk goes out the window the moment you recline on a water bed with a cocktail.  I've never been in here and not had a few new friends by the time I left.  The only thing that could use work is the music...If it starts to get dancy, keep it dancy!
author: ellyk E.

description:
oooooh, ahhhhhh, did you just hit my sweet spot?

ya, it's a little cramped and most likely a youngish crowd, but I can't help it - this place is skeevy fun!!  If you're not walking on imported air, then you are definitely walking on or watching some "I heart the 70's porn". 

RV Seats & Waterbeds.
Drinks!
Small Dance Floor
:)  Bartenders! - My bill was on the cheapside

The only thing I don't like is the crowdedness of getting from the front door to the back area.

Celebrated my 30th here a couple months ago and was there again last Saturday night for another girlfriends 30th & We Like da Kozy Kar!!
author: Jaime H.

description: If you wanna feel up/get felt up by post-college douche bags, then go here. Fun 80's music though.
author: Farah S.

description: This place is a total dive but not as divey as some. On Saturday nights they have all kinds of 80's rock and the small dance floor is so much fun! So glad I found this place.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: Decor is great. Water bed even greater (though I didn't sit on it, but really how could it be bad!) Bartenders cool. Prices fine. Tons of pinups and naked ladies pics line the wall. Totally unique experience. Everyone should experience Kozy Kar at least once.
author: Katie P.

description: It's an interesting concept--car seats for bar seats! The drinks are inexpensive, but I like having beer on tap. I could sort of overlook the porn mag pin-ups that covered almost every last surface of the place but the creepy student film freaked me out a bit. Saturday morning cartoons that were edited with bits of porn. Yeah... kind of hard to have conversations with your friends with that kind of thing going on behind their heads.
author: Frances L.

description: I've been here a hand-full of times since the place opened and I have to say it just gives me an A-OK vibe. It's a place you have to go to at least once just to see the decor (which is awesome) but once you've done that you probably won't go back. The staff is fine and the selection at the bar is fine, but nothing about this place really makes me want to walk in. I live a block away and walk by all the time, but there are much better bars in the area to visit.
author: Corey V.

description: This was for many many years a gay bar called the N Touch. Now when gay people go in this bar we are called faggots and treated badly. Hey Marina this was not always your house how about a few manors as you invade. This was the gayest neighborhood and now its the smuggest! Your bar just proves how ignorant the yuppies are. Stop calling gay patrons faggots. Have some class
author: Anna C.

description: Update:  It needs to be made clear that we weren't allowed in.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
This bar is a nightmare. Maybe if you're headin' out with the dudes, take a peek in here. If you're headin' out with women with any sense of class, don't go here at all. I'm not a very snobby person (I'm a pub-style-bar-if-there-are-chicken-wings-I'm-down kinda guy), but when there is porn plastered everywhere and a bar with 90% guys with creeper-staches and throw a dirty zebra print waterbed up front - it becomes a nightmare. I may be biased though...my girlfriend got harassed there and when I told the guy to get lost he kinda flipped out. Take it easy dude...ok maybe you were just joking around with her...but you really showed your true douche-bag colors when you flipped out. Lay off the machismo.

I gave it two stars because we had no trouble with bar service. 

Get a beer and be on your way.
author: Matt S.

description:
thank you kozy kar for letting me explore my inner whiteboy. you see, pops was military in his younger days and though i spent most my life in sf, i was born in fort campbell kentucky. thats pretty much as white as you can get. 

right to it. i love the theme. 70s porn. though last night there wasnt a hot white chick in roller skates, i dont think it wouldve good idea, at times, the place was packed wall to wall. gotta mention a thumbs up to the staff. even though it was that packed, they somehow managed to make sure everyone was taken care of from one long end of the bar to the other. i gotta say, i usually avoid crowded bars because i go to drink. if i cant get a fucking drink, why the fuck am i at a bar? the staff here did a great job. they all played spotter and motioned to the other staff members, over there, hes waiting.

the pole needs to be moved. i dont play all show and no go. the poles too close to the wall. 

the crowd? yeah. its gonna get all popped collar in here in a quick minute. enjoy it while you can. go on a school night.
author: Euge L.

description: One week in and it is, unfortunately, down to one star. I made the mistake of coming here on a Friday night and can see that it is going to be the hip new place for a crowd that is definitely not my thing. Fun concept, and I would still absolutely visit on a slow night, but those are probably gone, at least on the weekends, and have sadly made way for a bar full of drunk 20 something idiots.
author: Drue C.

description: Oh bless their heart, they just try so hard.  Unfortunately, when you miss "kitschy" you end up in hipsterville, on the corner of douche street and date rape avenue.
author: Charles D.

description: I love this place... the 70s porn decor along w/ a waterbed sitting area - haha... The drinks are good, stiff and cheap... and then you can get your groove and and shake that groove thing... yeah... yeah...
author: Minh V.

description:
what a fun night for ruggy's uye. the decor of this place is awesome. naked pics of women on the dancefloor itself, a bong hanging on the wall, fog, 2 waterbeds, tv's everywhere showing hits such as "boogie nights" and "anchorman", a stripper pole, and car-seats. bullshit to the cb radio's working though. we were trying to tell some random guy that he had a goofy hat on, but he couldn't seem to hear. 

this place has the cheapest quality drinks ever, but that goes with the style. schiltz, pbr, hamm's, friggin taaka vodka... the waterbeds were cool, but it was an adventure to get on it. you had to climb through a hole. literally... 

lastly, i love how the website says that frat boys are not allowed and that they should go to the marina instead. yet, the crowd was as marina as can get by night's end. i had no problem with it though :)
author: Andrew T.

description: I really enjoy going to this bar. Its totally crazy inside, but I always have a blast! Prices and drink quality are so-so.
author: Emily B.

description: A great place to hang out with friends and enjoy the 70's cool ambiance. You can tell the owner put a lot of thought and energy into the decorating including the 70s vehicle bucket seats, waterbed, missle command video game and various other touches. We thought the bouncer and the bar tender were nice and we are looking forward to going back with friends and trying out the dance floor.
author: Shannon W.

description: Cool bar on Polk Street. Came here with a few friends to grab some brews and had a good time.
author: Darius A.

description: So I went on a Friday...it was pretty crowded (a good thing)...especially for 8:30..the theme was cool and very different but once the horrible beer got warm..that's about the same time the surroundings got old and uninteresting...but I did enjoy looking at the naked 70's women on the floor for about 10 minutes... but go and see it and get it out of your system.
author: Kevin B.

description: Call me a hipster for liking throwbacks and pbr but you can't argue with porn, fog machines, vintage clips, good fing classic rock, and water beds.  The owner is super nice- free shots! And we brought in donuts. Yeah, see you there.
author: Sydel S.

description:
Kozy Kar is exactly as it would seem by it's name: A Cozy Car, but with a little Kinky twist. If you turned your conversion van into a mobile sex club, I would guess it would be a little something like this place. The floor was decorated with a collage of beautiful naked women (pictures of course), so even when the music got a little stale (serious drunken-depression kind of music) you would have something to look at to cheer you up. Or if some dude-bag came to execute some terrible pick-up line, you could effectively pull the lesbian card while staring at the floor. 
But, I must say, It sure seems to draw a crowd... to the point of over population. After a couple hours, the music and "Koziness" got the best of me and I just needed to escape. If I chose one reason why it lost those 2 stars, I guess my main complaint would be the music. It totally dampened my social mood and there was no escaping the 120 decibels of sadness blaring all around. My voice box still sounds broken after trying to keep up a conversation over that crap. It made me want to stick the pretend exhaust pipe (well.... fogger) through one of the windows and let everyone peacefully die along with me... in which case, let's hope it's not a hybrid.
author: sharlene s.

description: While I really enjoyed my time in the water bed, I wished my friends who'd brought me here would have warned me so I could leave the spike heels and mini-skirt at home. Anyway, despite some mild awkwardness and discomfort crawling into the bed, I was totally thrilled and excited to enjoy my drink in such an unusual locale. The crowd here is mixed
author: Michelle L.

description: Porn, waterbeds and a stripper pole oh my!  How can one go wrong? I didn't think the place was super impressive, but definitely  had a fun concept and its a pretty chill place, I would totally go again.  I don't think I would try out the waterbed again but thats cuz I forgot how uncomfortable I was laying on one when I was a kid, it's been a couple days and I'm still sore.  It's something everyone who goes in there should try though, gives you a chance to "accidentally" fall into the lap of some other person in the bed with you when you are tryin to get out.
author: Rebecca D.

description: A Waterbed and retro 70's becky on every screen, this one is interesting to say the least.
author: William H L.

description: CB radios, boxed wine, shag carpeting, chicks on roller skates, and drinking in vans from the '70s. Now not every bar can say they have that, can they?
author: Alex H.

description: Just a regular neighborhood bar decorated in 70's theme. Waterbed seating, booths, old van mounted into the wall with seating, dance floor, disco ball, kitschy 70's pictures decoupaged on the floor.... Basic drinks, nothing fancy. Bartender is pretty nice. 2 drinks (vodka/sprite + gin/tonic) was $12. It's nice to have a casual hangout bar without any pretenses in the 'hood.
author: Maren P.

description: The decor was fun, music was great and the dance floor was an awesome montage of pin-up models. Really the only drag about this place was the slew of bridge and tunnel/Marina obnoxious, entitled, white men. I've never seen so many striped collared shirts outside of the financial district. Hopefully this joint can be taken over by the fun crowd this bar is beckoning to at some point. It's possible we were there on a rare unfortunate night.
author: Amaris B.

description:
love it love it love it. 

after reading all of the great reviews i was almost nervous to come to kozy kar. how could it possibly live up to my expectations? especially those created after i visited their bitchin site (maaaaybe i wouldnt visit this site at work though, fyi). but this place did meet and exceed and i cannot wait to go back!

the people were fun, the decor was awesome, the bartenders were super helpful, fast, and not the pretentious dbags you sometimes get pouring your drinks (or opening your malt liquors) in this city. The only fyi I have for the chicks out there is:

** in the ladies room, i dont recommend using the stall on the right if you are modest, the guys i was with "noticed" you might be able to see a reflection off of the floor, and it is a floor the boys will have their eyes on.
author: LeeAnne T.

description: Kozy Kar is a great place to have a loud drunken time. Decent mix of nice people and the energy is good. The bartenders are on it and plenty of cold pricey PBRs. We came here as a decent sized group after the company xmas party so we were well greased and it was a great place to land.
author: William R.

description:
I've been twice now-once on a Wed and once on a Sat. Got seats both times including the water bed at some point in both nights. Love the decor and the people. The line on Sat moved quick. They served my fernet on the rocks in a big cup not a tiny shot glass or a reg glass. And by the way fernet is $7 everywhere on polk street and like $10 at Bubble Lounge the other night, so go to your own street if you wanna cry about that.

As for Sam, the owner, he gets five stars too. I was a drunk idiot like a lot of us are on Saturday nights and lost everything including my drink. What did Sam say? I'll replace it (the drink) and he did. Then at 2:54 am I get a call from Sam saying sorry they didn't find my id and debit card--which I somehow woke up with anyway (just so all you yelpers just looking to talk trash don't try to come up with something ridiculous like stuff gets stolen at kk).

I'm Kozy Krazy and I'll be back.
author: Brittani Q.

description: This place is the coolest!!! Nothing beats being at a bar that has waterbeds, beer, light bright peg signs, and sexy ladies everywhere!!!
author: Erin H.

description: Walked in here with about 10 friends last Saturday....and immediately got attitude from the bartender (a dude...don't know his name..nor do I care). I guess he wasn't happy about having 10 extra people to serve? Carded all of us even though most of us were over 40. Maybe we were too straight and normal-looking to be in the bar? I can't quite figure it out, but he had it out for us the moment we entered. We tipped...because we aren't the types to punish any other bartender working there or staff. (I'm sure the d-bag pocketed it all, though.) Can't remember a time I was treated so poorly by a "service" person before (yes, bartenders are service people...sorry...that means they should serve, not bark at customers). Never going here again. A "pub crawl" group came in while we were on our way out of the door....would have liked to have stuck around to see how they were treated!.
author: Erin F.

description: I love this place for two main reasons: (1) cheap beer in a can with a STRAW. I love straws and anything out of a straw tastes at least 10x better, and (2) the seventies porn on the floor. I'm not a pervert, but when I come to Kozy Kar I just can't keep my eyes off of it, it's mesmerizing. So maybe those aren't the best reasons for liking a bar, but those are my reasons.
author: Rose K.

description:
Maybe I'm an easy sell, but I love the kitsch that KK has added to lower Polk. 

The crowd can be mixed, but I've met some hilarious kids here, made some legitimate friends, and have had more than a couple awesome, greyhound-fueled dance parties on the porn-covered floor.
author: Allie H.

description: This place is a hoot- modeled after 1970s vans.  What an idea!  I think for the first 15 minutes I was there, I couldn't get over this! Other than the cooky idea of Kozy Kar, this was an average bar serving up cans of PBR as their special.  But it wasn't really that special by paying $3 for a can of PBR- but hey it was fun.
author: Cara D.

description: it's a pretty interesting bar. I liked the inside. drinks were pretty reasonable. all the porn and nude women pics all over the walls was pretty interesting. I can't wait to come back!
author: Brian B.

description:
well that was a crazy night. fun times, crazy crowded, rv seats and waterbeds sure are kind of nice for some i suppose. 

most intriguing part: floor of naked women (pictures) and pin up girls. and porn with some large inappropriateness robbing me blind while i drink. 

now that was interesting.
author: Fiona S.

description: I just recently discovered all the excitement that is Polk St and absolutely loved this place! They play a great variety of music and have a very diverse crowd. My friends and I were even lucky enough to score the water bed (which apparently if you are able to get on it, you monopolize it for the whole evening). The entire atmosphere of Kozy Kar is unique from any bar I've been to... and yes, I've been to quite a few.
author: Steven M.

description: I mean, someone definitely took into consideration the all the details to this place (i'm talking about the small steering wheel light fixtures and opening credits of 70s shows on the tvs)... i'm just not so sure about the pornography all over the place as well as the shag covers on the water beds, which need to be sterilized, i think. But tall drinks at reasonable prices makes it all ok.
author: Andy A.

description: Cheap beer - PBR, Olympia - 70's porn underneath the bar and on the dance floor (feathered hair and all), what's not to like? Kind of tough to grab a seat, as groups tend to claim on of the 'vans' and not really leave it during the duration of the night. That said, still a fun, laid back bar to enjoy with your friends.
author: PM M.

description: I just moved here and this is an absolutely fun bar!! Very 'kozy' , great bartenders,  great vibe,  one of my favorite local bars!  Their furniture is very unique to say the least, a classic dive bar!!
author: Shannon O.

description: 5 stars for the waterbed covered in red shag carpeting. Fun, fun, fun. If you don't get it, we're probably not friends, and you need to loosen up.
author: Megasaurus B.

description: Stumbled into this place on a Tuesday night with some friends... Wasn't quite sure what to think from the rainbow "lite brite" sign outside. Upon entering, it had a pretty good vibe. Lots of different, random types of peoples.. We grabbed a booth in the back near the floor covered in naked ladies from back when bush was "in." Our table had waterbed-like cushions. BELIEVE ME, I had a good time with THAT :) My guy friends got me a kettle-soda, but I noticed they were all drinking Miller, which made me wonder if that's all they had. We stayed for a drink and then left, but I'll definitely be back for a return visit when I'm in the mood for a cheap beer.
author: Christy K.

description: Olympia Beer? Yes please! One of the few bars in the city with my favorite cheap beer and rad bartenders too. Kitsch makes life interesting, and it certainly works here. I loved it all. We actually bypassed another "themed" bar in the neighborhood packed with unsavories...serenity now!...then ahhh, Kozy Kar.
author: M-Britt L.

description: Alright I know reviews are mixed on this place, but I went for the first time on Friday and I actually had a really great time. You have to appreciate it for what it is, a 70's novelty bar in Nob Hill.There was a line but we got right in (granted we were five girls), and the bartender/owner only charged me for one of the three drinks I ordered that night. It was a mixed crowd because of the Berkeley/USC game, so lots of LA types hanging about. I would definitely come here again with more friends although I can't say I'd make it a regular hang out spot. Everyone knocks on the novelty factor, but sorry thats what sells. Every bar in SF from Minna to the Castle have decades nights, this is just taking it to another level. It may be a shameless ploy for business and buzz, but I loved its postmodern appeal nonetheless.
author: Meagan F.

description: Hit this on a weekend, crowded, loud but looks like it has it's moments... think we just missed it.
author: Sean F.

description: Cute neighborhood bar.  A bit expensive for its ambiance but would make a nice place to grab a cocktail if I lived up there.
author: Ankur P.

description: I didn't know what I was getting myself into when I first stepped into the Kozy Kar. I was thrown off by the grainy 70's porn mixed in with school house rock playing on the TVs. The longer I was there, the more I fell in love with this bar. Every "booth" has different kind of car seats and some are even had shag carpet covered water beds. I would come back but maybe on a busier night. It was pretty dead on a Wednesday night and there were some interesting people in there.
author: Jamie E.

description: The most fun and curious bar I've been to in awhile. Love the X rated decor and good strong drinks. I good place to chill.
author: Shannon B.

description:
this place is definitely a place to go relieve the hipster out of me!

small, quaint themed retro bar with loads of vintage nuggets.

dance floor laced with vintage porn, retro car booths with cb radios and televisions airing retro shows are a plus.

selling point are the shaggy waterbeds. i may eventually take a nap there during hour...so cozy

they also take donuts as a form of currency. traded two glazed donuts for a shot!
author: chris m.

description: I always end up here bombed. The nudie pics on the bar distract me from the drink prices, which aren't really that bad.
author: Uri B.

description: Why is the owner such a prick? Look, not everybody is going to like your bar, deal with it, get over it and move on.
author: David J.

description: Been here only once. Had a fine time and was only there for a drink, but we had a good laugh when patrons sitting on the water bed realized their butts were wet from the leaking bed. I'm sure it's been fixed and no longer leaks, but I definitely had a good laugh (the wet-butted peeps had a good laugh, too).
author: Megan D.

description: This place low-key creeps me out.  The bar itself is tiny, no room behind the bar to mingle or wait for a drink- there is a one person walkway behind the barstool so if you're not seated at the bar, you're in the way.  Make your way to the small back room and there are 3, maybe 4 small car themed booths with oldish monitors playing porn.  This can invoke two reactions: 1) put the porn on the back burner as part of the ambiance or 2) stand and stare at it in front of everyone.  I saw creepy looking men standing and staring fixated at it for a good 20 minutes completely alone, which speaks to the kind of people a porn-themed bar might attract.  In general the place seems like it could use a good cleaning and replacement of everything from the floors to the monitors to the seating arrangements. If that's your bag, Kozy Kar is the right place.  If you want to have fun and dance in a classier setting, go to Blur, Hemlock, Mayes, Vertigo or any of the other fun bars on Polk street.  Just my two cents.
author: Farah T.

description: This place rocks.  Awesome selection of cheap beer, loud arena 70s rock, interesting mix of people and perfectly kitsch decor.  If I lived closer, I would be a regular.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Dude soup was the special of the night on the Friday I went. There a naked centerfolds everywhere so that was a plus until I saw the 
three dudes just chilling in the back with no shirts on. Def a unique bar worth trying out for the decor but hopefully the dude ratio isn't so high when you go.
author: andrew m.

description: Interesting looking place, just like the photos they posted. Not a big fan of this style, that's why only 3 stars. But yea, have some changes are always good. PP are friendly and friends have a good time. Not bad ^^
author: Flora F.

description:
this bar is the shittiest place in the bay. the bouncer thinks his dick is worth more than a $1.49 

trouble is, his dick is so small that he cant find his own boyfriends dick if it kissed him in te ass, which it did, cause "Wu Tang Clan ain't nothin to fuck with!" ... ya Diggggg?
author: Bo J.

description: too bad the staff are too fucking stupid to keep the back door closed after they shut down for the night...  really super disrespectful of their neighbors who can hear every single word as they yell at each other across the bar and get their post-work drink on...  kind of makes me want to call the ABC the very next time I see their patrons standing out on the sidewalk with drinks in hand -- the kind of stuff your neighbors see all the time...
author: Martin A.

description: The bouncer at this place is a complete tool and a serious deterrent for male patrons. I'm speaking from several experiences now. Some from observations between him and others and from my own experiences dealing with him...Get a life you f***ing moron.
author: Nick L.

description: always liked this place til last night. me and my friends went out to smoke. it was 130 and they locked the bar, wouldnt let us get our shit and said we had to go "one at a time" my friends had full drinks and we had to wait forever to get back in. we asked what the owners name was and the door man with the cheap accent said "juan" when i asked his name he also said "juan" it was fucking 130 .... like really.. we just wanted our shit and our drinks and our friends
author: Simone K.

description: Wow! This bar ROCKS!! It has an awesome decor. Obviously, vintage car theme, and it has a shag bed you can lay on and sip drinks. It also has a table that rotates and spins in a circle. A small dance floor to boogey down. The vibe is so cool here, and NO COVER! The only complaint is that because it is a small bar, you have to fight to get to the bar to order, but worth the wait! The bar makes you feel like you're in a shaggin' wagon, and the dance floor is a series of vintage playboy pictures.
author: Sam S.

description: This spot is just OK.  I mainly drink beer and the selection was like limited.  Even if the selection expands there is nothing too special about the place.  Its cool to check out the bar but there is not much to keep you there.  What I did like were the seats at the bar which are super comfortable.  I was there on a Thursday night around 10pm and the crowd was good, not too packed. It was cool for the 30 minutes I was there.  I probably won't be back but maybe.
author: Chuck Q.

description: Why would a Bar owner think it's "cool" to force people to wait in line for a bar that is empty inside, especially on Polk!!  Don't recommend this place at all.
author: Russ R.

description: Stumbled into Kozy Kar already warm off that Long Island last sipped at Monahans. Somehow made it over the hill and up to some place that wasn't the marina. Was it Russian Hill, or nob hill or some kind of tender place I've been hearing about recently? Can't quite be sure, its likely the Long Island blurred my memory of the route and geographic location, but not the lounge. I am sitting on a plush couch next to a guy I've met who tells me about this drink I've never heard of. He buys me a Seagrams Seven and Seven, and tells me I'm pretty. Thanks. We sit and talk and he tells me he's from North Carolina which is my favorite place in the whole wide world. I'm not sure if it was Kozy Kar or him that made me smile, but I'd like to think its some kind of combination of the two. There were people dancing in outfits I've only ever seen in the Castro, and the music was dark wave eighties electronica what ever, but all that was just fun to look at and listen to. When I think of Kozy Kar and the music, and the people we watched, I'll always think of sitting on the couch drinking my new favorite drink with my new friend from my favorite place in the world.
author: Michelle K.

description: Porn, waterbeds and a stripper pole....if you are wavering on a date, go to Kozy Kar.  If you don't hook up, it wasn't meant to be.
author: The P.

description: Porn on the floor, porn on the wall, porn on the bar.. its an explosion of 1970s big hairy bushed porn.. you know right there its going to be an epic place.. I really admired the light bright sign.. it was a clever way to add into the 1970s retro van themed bar.. the bar itself was layed out well.. it has two waterbeds and booths with a tree shaped car freshener hanging from it.. miny dance floor with awesome old school hits playing.. The bar itself has a great vibe to it and i cant imagine anyone having a bad time while they are there.. all of the bartenders kick ass and know how to make a strong drink.. my only complaint is whats with covering up the man parts?! we get titties coming at you from every direction and a multi colored box covering peter and the boys! come on! lets see that thunder from down under! All in all this place is the shit and i cant wait to get my ass back on that waterbed!
author: Ashley M.

description: My favorite bar in the whole world. Totally worth the drive from the East Bay. Every weekend.
author: Hotdogger G.

description: I got cozy on the waterbed at the Kozy Kar with my ladies.  It's a great place to just chill and rock to the 70's and 80's.  The decor was very interesting and fun.  The dance floor was a little small but it wasn't too crowded when we went so it worked out.  Oh yeah, the door guy is super hot!
author: Lai I.

description: Kozy Kar is my favorite bar in the city!!!  Brian the bartender ROCKS!!!   In fact, he may just be the best bartender in town!!! And he has a great laugh, so humor him!!!!  I stop in often because the drinks are strong, the music is good, and who can forget about the porn that randomly plays during the music videos!!!!  I would recommend this bar to anyone who wants to have a good time with a fantastic crowd!!!
author: kara S.

description: totally rude door guy, wrong charge on my credit card, marina crowd. enough said.
author: Betty Z.
